results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and what we have to offer so you can have the sex life and relationships that you really want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at this event are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON New York City!

group.name: Single Men and Single Women in NYC!!!

results.description:
The Place: This joint effort from the owners of Freemans and The Smile offers modern, veggie-forward French fare in a refurbished Lower East Side space with white-painted brick walls and eclectic furnishings. 

http://leturtle.fr/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks. 

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.
results.name: Le Turtle - French

results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki & Chris Pelham

A Course in Miracles and A Course of Love classes are $20 each

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.

These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
Healing Clinic suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!
results.why: It's a concrete and energizing way to develop the ability to meditate and to come to know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation more clearly. You can also learn to communicate with your Inner Teacher and find peace!

Monday Night Volleyball is intended to be for more advanced, fast paced volleyball geared toward players capable of defending against a hard spike, playing within a structured offensive and defensive system. Some nights we will set up a separate net for more advanced players. This will be up to the discretion of the organizers. 

No beginners, or lower skilled players please.

Please consider your safety and the safety of others when signing up. In faster systems, please realize that being out of position can result in injuries. 


A few rules :

1. Call violations on yourselves. There is no referee. 

2. A ball will be dead when entering the other court. This is for safety reasons. It doesn't matter whether the ball interferes with play or not.

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• Cha-Cha- Cha (The cha-cha-cha, or simply cha-cha, is a dance of Cuban origin. It is danced to the music of the same name introduced by Cuban composer and violinist Enrique Jorrin in the early 1950s. This rhythm was developed from the danzón-mambo. The name of the dance is an onomatopoeia derived from the shuffling sound of the dancers' feet.)

Please wear sporty, comfortable cloths and sports shoes.

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Docks Oyster Bar
40th and 3rd Ave
(633 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

results.description:
LeTip of Hoboken

Are you looking for a way to successfully market your business? Want better, higher quality business leads? Then you have come to the right group. Survey after survey indicates that referral networking is the most cost-effective part of the marketing mix. By joining a LeTip chapter, savvy entrepreneurs are able to consistently prospect and be visible. LeTip of Hoboken has members that not only need and will use your business services, they also know others in need of your services. Each LeTip member acts as an extension to your sales and marketing team.

The LeTip Creed

LeTip is a professional networking organization of men and women dedicated to the highest standards of competence and service. Our purpose is the exchange of business tips. Members will, at all times, maintain the highest professional integrity. Each business category is represented by one member and conflicts of interest are disallowed.


A typical meeting has the following components to help you build your business: 

• You introduce your company at every meeting

• Your chapter passes qualified business Tips (Leads) throughout the meeting

• You Showboat your product two or more times a year, giving you ample opportunity to train your newfound sales force

• You have access to the expertise of other LeTip members, ongoing training and mentoring 

• Your chapter has the potential to provide a wide reach into the business community

• You become the speaker several times a year, putting the spotlight clearly on your business.


The following categories are no longer open:

Mortgage Banker
Realtor
Business Banker
Title Insurance
Real Estate Attorney
Life and Health Insurance
Accountant
results.name: LeTip of Hoboken Weekly Meetup

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

Stop by Sawhorse Media's HQ for the thirty fifth installment of the revived SocialTV NYC meetup. This month's special guest will be Justin Swarz (@jswizza), the Director of Branded Entertainment for Studio 71 . 

Studio 71, in case you're unfamiliar, is a subsidiary of German media group ProSiebenSat.1, and is committed to entertaining the world through digital content. The company operates one of the largest global multi-channel networks with over 3.5 billion monthly views on YouTube with wide social distribution through Vine, Snapchat, Instagram, and Facebook. Aside from social networks, S71 has a highly diversified distribution strategy through partnerships with Amazon, go90, Watchable, and Twitter.


Bagels, coffee, juice and fruit will be provided as usual! NOTE - we are going to be at Sawhorse Media's NEW office on Broadway and Bleecker (see address), don't go to the old office on Prince :). MAKE SURE YOU TELL THE SECURITY GUARD THAT YOU ARE THERE FOR SAWHORSE MEDIA SO HE CAN LET YOU UP IN THE ELEVATOR. YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO PRESS THE ELEVATOR BUTTON TO THE 9TH FLOOR ON YOUR OWN.

Also, reminder that this is an off the record conversation. Thanks!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus.

Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.

• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps.

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!

• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show

• A great profile pic

So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Send us a profile picture too, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast on Saturday (soundboxonline.com). Also check out Carl J and ADG presents where you can find all of our mixes back. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.

Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G.

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

Looking to develop speaking and leadership skills? Ace a job interview? Ignite your career? Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Our membership is 280,000 strong. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 13,500 clubs like Bryant Park Toastmasters Club Membership in Manhattan

Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At Bryant Park Toastmasters we provide a safe environment to overcome fear, try new speaking tactics, or practice that upcoming sales presentation. Visit our website

MEETING TIME: Tuesday, 12:10pm to 1:15pm

VISITORS WELCOME: In order for you visit our club you need to register to this meeting and RSVP with your FULL NAME  AT MOST  SUNDA. Please arrive by Noon to allow extra time for security check-in.

** PHOTO ID a must!!

** Bring your confirmation email from a Bryant Park club member having added you to the security list is a must!! 


A Toastmasters Meeting always for follows the same agenda:

• Opening of the meeting by the president and presentation of the guests


• Welcoming by the Toastmaster of the Day and presentation of the watchtowers


• Speeches and Evaluations (up to 4)


• Club Business


• Table Topics Session - Guest can participate if they want to


• General Evaluation


• Closing of the meeting

results.description:
REGISTRATION REQUIRED AT:
www.csusa.org/coolcopyright

Join us as the New York Chapter caps off the[masked] Season with a discussion on works not traditionally thought of in the copyright law context.

From tattoos to graffiti to other types of cutting-edge creative concepts often found in uncommon media, these art forms are heating up court dockets and are raising new questions and issues for plaintiffs and defendants. Join us as our panel of experts explores the contours of claims, defenses, damages calculations, and other legal theories that surround the use and enforcement of these “cool” copyrights.

SCHEDULE:
Check-In 12pm
Lunch 12:30pm
Program 1-2pm

COST
SPECIAL DEAL: Bring a friend and receive $15 off your friend's registration. Use code CoolCopyrightFriend. One friend per registrant.

Members: Early-Bird $70, after deadline $80
Non-Members: Early-Bird $85, after deadline $95
Student Members*: Early-Bird $55, after deadline $65 Email [masked] for your promotional code

*Must be a CSUSA member to receive student rate. Student membership is just $25 and comes with many great benefits. Please visit www.csusa.org/join for more information.

DEADLINES
Early-Bird Rate Deadline: May 6
Final Deadline: May 17


CANCELLATION POLICY
Refunds must be requested in writing at least three business days before the event. Refunds will not be issued after that point. Unfortunately, we will not be able to credit your registration payment toward a future event, but you may allow another person attend in your place.

New to the Copyright Society of the USA?
To learn about the benefits of membership, please visit www.csusa.org.

Already a member but need to renew for the[masked] season?
Please visit www.csusa.org. All memberships expired on September 30, 2015. If you have already renewed, thank you!

Come join us for "Savanting Circles".  Savanting Circles are a facilitated, safe place to brainstorm, ask questions, get and give ideas; all in a group of motivated, trailblazing women who are eager to help each other out.

It’s a group of powerful women getting together who UNDERSTAND the power of getting together.  This is very important because it brings women together who are in it to win!  Most business women face similar challenges. The diverse perspectives from the group enabled the members to gain insight on how to best resolve their issues.

 Early on in our entrepreneurial journey we discovered the power of masterminding and it changed our lives and business and we know it will change yours too.

 We know that not everyone has $500, $600 or $1,000 to be part of a mastermind group and because of all the amazing, positive growth we’ve seen not only in our business but also that of our members; we whole-heartedly believe that every female entrepreneur needs it as part of her success formula.  

Savanting Circles are included in our membership and conveniently happen online and live.

*Brainstorm new ideas

*Create joint ventures

*Connect with members 

*Foster positive personal relationships

*Gain business tools and help each other grow

results.description:
Come join us for our Community HU Chant for a spiritual uplift during your lunch hour.  We meet every Tuesday from 12:30 - 1:00pm for the HU followed by light refreshments and discussion.   The HU Chant will last about twenty minutes.  It will be followed by approximately five minutes of silent contemplation.  Light refreshments and discussion will follow.  Please feel free to bring a sack lunch!

Experience HU, a love song to God.  It is the sound within all sounds.  It represents the love of God for Soul, and we are Soul.  HU represents the enormous love that the Creator has for Its creation.  To listen, please visit:  www.HearHU.org. 

A Spiritual Exercise:  HU is an ancient name for God.  When you sing HU, you open our heart to the Light and Sound of God. Here is a simple spiritual exercise to try. First, close your eyes and look gently to a point between your eyebrows.  Then, softy sing HU (pronounbced like the word "hue").  Now sit quietly for a few minutes.  Watch and listen for the presence of God.  It  may come as a light or a sound or in some other way.
results.how_to_find_us: take elevator to 5th floor and walk  to other side of building

results.description:
I give a 'free', forever ongoing, astronomy class at the Senior Center.  You don't have to be a senior to join, but you must join the Senior Center for $72/year, which you can defer for at least a month, until you determine that you want to continue.

I never give the same lecture twice.  It would bore me.  My lectures are well prepared, and contain enormous resources from the live web, projected from my laptop to a flat screen TV.  It's all about gaining a perspective of your/my place in the universe.

==================

The class meets Tuesdays at 12:45pm.  Just come.  241 W 72st.  Ask for Laird.  (As of August, 2014, as well as for the last 5 years.)

To make sure the class isn't cancelled (it normally meets every week of the year), please email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in the email.  (It gets sorted away from my inbox.)
results.why: Astronomy is about EVERYTHING.  Or at least thats why I became interested in it in 2nd grade.  Now, 40 years post Ph.D. in Astronomy, Astronomy, and indeed all of science is still my passion.   My advisor was Carl Sagan.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in your email.
results.name: Weekly Astronomy Class - (free the first month you attend).

The heART of Networking: 5 Keys to Network with Ease For Pay-It-Forward Minded Professionals & Business Owners.

Do you dread going to networking events? Want to make the most of your time spent at a networking event or want more confidence at an event?  Maybe you just want to make networking a more fun experience for yourself?

This program is hosted by Christine Clifton, The Connected Conversation Expert, Founder of Mindful Business Matters and Author of “You don’t have to shout to Stand Out”

During this highly-interactive seminar you will learn:   - ‘Pay-it-Forward’ networking techniques that help others – and you too!

  - A 5-key process to create your own custom networking formula

  - How to keep your energy strong when networking

This presentation is ideal for:


• Independent Professionals – Financial, Insurance, Coaches, Consultants • Business Owners – Retail, Chiropractic, Restaurants • Company Professionals – Banking, In job-search, Business Development • Creatives - Photographers, Web Designers, Graphic Artists • Any thoughtful person who doesn’t love networking

You'll leave this presentation with specific actions to take that will make your networking easier, so you feel more confident marketing yourself and your services!


Cost:  FREE for NJCC Members; $20 for Non-Members & Meetup Members

RSVP Online @ http://www.northjerseychamber.org/Events/The-heART-of-Networking-5-Keys-to-Network-with-Ease-708.htm

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
This event is currently at its maximum and is closed to new players.

From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension: The Isle of Dread

results.description:
Are you currently consulting as a lean / design strategist or thinking to breaking out on your own?

Organizations are expanding the scope of how they approach innovation, and Product and UX consultants have emerged as a powerful force in that initiative. Yet, impacting the organization from the outside is not without its challenges.


Join Alpha and Product School for a dinner and panel to discuss the best practices for successful partnerships between product teams and consultants. Speakers include:

Boris Grinkot works with Fortune 100s -- including Johnson & Johnson, Bank of America, Humana, and Schlumberger -- and has mentored hundreds of intrapreneurs and startups on disciplined experimentation. His focus is innovation governance.

Bob Gower is the Director of Process and Innovation Management at Citrusbyte, where he helps develop teams that deliver incredible products.

Sarah Doody is a user experience designer and product strategist. She is passionate about working with early stage and established products - turning their vision into engaging customer experiences.

Jesse Reiner is a Sr. Product Manager with over a decade of experience developing digital products and services in concert with innovative business leaders, designers and software engineers.

RSVP and pay directly on Eventbrite ($20, discounted to $15 for our meetup members using this link): https://productconsulting.eventbrite.com/?discount=lean
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd Floor
results.name: Product Consulting: How organizations can partner with experts to innovate

We'll feature fellows from our Tow-Knight Entrepreneurial Journalism program. 

The 18 presenters come from 12 countries and have been developing their startup projects for the past 15 weeks. In our Tow-Knight program, fellows study new business models for news, sharpen their entrepreneurial skills and explore media innovation in NYC.  

Here's a full list of the startups presenting, along with brief bios.

Doors Open 5:30pm (Arrival and settling in, networking)
Presentations 6:00pm - 9:00pm (18 demos, 4-minutes each, plus q&a)

This year's startups include:

• Journalists from 12 countries, our most int'l group ever.

• A digital community for young Muslim travelers.

• A platform for publishers to share news with a geographic  community.

• A service that gathers news and analysis from Zimbabwean women.

• A multimedia journalist inspired by New York's grandmothers. 

• The former editor-in-chief of the Sydney Morning Herald

• The first woman to be top editor of a national Venezuelan newspaper.


• The first data-driven news agency in Brazil, reporting on human rights,social development, economic issues and technology.


... and more terrific media entrepreneurs.

Click here for a full list of projects and bios.

Please note: this will be a longer event than our usual demo nights. We'll keep the pace quick, with each presentation clocking in at four minutes to accommodate the 18 startups presenting! results.description:
Where: The Irish Exit, 978 2nd Avenue NY, NY

What: "Open borders" is a term both meaningful and meaningless. At once it conveys visions of countries without lines of demarcation, countries without imperial nationalism, and countries without boundaries we can protect. But that's mostly because most people just don't know much about what "open borders" really means or entails. So let's talk about it! Should our borders be open or closed? What would open borders even look like? Are open borders a threat to our national sovereignty or a necessity for operating as a humane country that's part of a globalized world? Yevgeniy Feyman from the Manhattan Institute will educate us on open borders from a philosophical and policy-based perspective. But because collaboration is the best form of education, we'll all help to educate each other through Q&A and discussion.

Cost: $5, includes drinks and finger food

=======================================

A reservation and pre-payment is required:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/afffee-present-lets-talk-about-open-borders-tickets-18530198322?mc_cid=25b90ae34b&mc_eid=40bf1e2261
results.name: AFF/FEE: Yevgeniy Feyman on What An Open Borders Policy Would Really Mean

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!...then bar party with everyone!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com

Gather to experience a FREE empowering yoga class thought by a fellow member exclusively for HealthTech Women.  We will begin with a 45 minute empowering yoga class, followed by networking and beverages starting at 7 pm in Maialino in Gramercy Park Hotel.  


Part of being an effective leader is managing stress.  Yoga and meditation based relaxation technique, uses a systematic method of complete physical, mental and emotional relaxation. In this session, you will release tension, relax the mind and reduce stress as you experience a restful “yogic sleep”.

About the Yoga Instructor Annie Fisco:

Annie shifted her path from B- school to her passion and lifestyle of health, wellness and vitality. Annie is a connector at heart, and teaches you how to live your absolute best life by celebrating and creating the life you want. Annie teaches a vigorous yoga class that challenges you both physically and mentally. Annie empowers her students to find their own greatness, and to be of possibility in all areas of their lives.

Annie is a strong leader and is launching The NY Yoga + Life magazine & digital, she is building, empowering and growing a mindful and healthy wellness community. Being up to something bigger, supporting and empowering women and men to live extraordinary lives and it all starts with your true north.


"My goal is to walk into a room and make the lights get brighter... empower you.


Please  note that the yoga class is limited to the first 12 registerations - networking starts at 7 pm and open to all.
results.name: Empowering Yoga and Networking

results.description:
Are you a technology professional?  

Come expand your business network by building relationships with other types of tech service providers.

This meetup is for BNI technology professionals to meet with other BNI chapter members to help educate them on technology products and how that technology can help their business. We are partnering with WeWork to bring in visitors to help expand our referral marketing networks. 

Not all technology related professions are represented in every chapter across BNI so there is a lot of potential to help tech members in each chapter. We are looking for speakers from the BNI network. The format will be 5 speakers from 5 chapters giving 8 minute presentations. 

We still have a couple of slots open. In order to be considered as a speaker, you must help bring members and visitors to the event. We will be looking to have one session room, with a breakout room where people can network and even put up a shingle advertising their business to anyone who wants to chat. The programming will be kept to 1 hour with a half hour of networking on either end. If you know anyone who would like to bring samples of the food and beverages that their business provides, we would love to speak with them.

Speakers:

Eliminating Accounts-Receivables in your Business

What to expect: 

An overview of the evolution in the Payments space (ApplePay, Chip-and-Pin, Fraud issues) from the leading professional in the sectorHow the proper Payments setup can help any company ELIMINATE “outstanding/unpaid Accounts-Receivables” at their firms

Key Points of presentatio

n: 

Tools that enable the complete elimination of outstanding A/R and the proper setup for increased future revenueCurrent Integrations with relevant Accounting-software and Sales/Marketing software

Presented By:  Ben Prusky, CEO of Freedom Merchants Corp.


What’s Your Magic?

Helen Coupe will share how emotion-based technology can help companies to enhance human interaction and unlock the full potential of their talent.


Magency’s customizable app allows everyone’s voice to be heard. Experience it for yourself during the talk by voting, asking questions and connecting to others in the room.

Magency disrupts traditional corporate events and training by transforming them into interactive, engaging experiences through it’s mobile solutions and interactive installations. Founded by a tech illusionist, Magency uses magic to inspire it's technology. Magency’s unique approach transforms attendees from spectators to actors, creating unforgettable moments. In three years, Magency has become a global leader in the digital events and training industry, hosting over 500 events on five continents, in 29 different countries with 20 different language and is a trusted partner of Procter & Gamble, Nissan, Airbus, LVMH, Chevrolet, and more.


Helen Coupe, Key Account Manager at Magency 


BNI Chapter 70


Understanding the Mobile Functionality and Advantages of Text Message based Fundraising

What to expect: 

A detailed overview explaining text message based fundraising. The ultimate goal is to stress that text message based fundraising (when used for events and galas) is a live and real-time fundraising platform that uses live audience interaction in order to raise money. 

Key Points of presentation: 

1. Differences between Text message based fundraising and mobile fundraising. 

2. Explaining how small start up charities and large non-profits can use text message based fundraising to grow their donation levels and outreach.

3. Explaining how text message based fundraising creates a bridge for easy communication between the donor and non-profit organization. 

4. Showing how a text message based fundraising platform can increase donor retention and predict the giving capacity of a crowd. 

Presented By:  David Mack, Director of Business Development for Text-to-Pledge.

BNI Chapter 12


Saving Money and Avoiding Headaches Through Technology Leasing

What to expect: 

Understand the dramatic savings (both tangible and intangible) that technology leasing can provide both large and small businesses.

Key Points of presentation:

DDI’s 20-year track record of providing flexible, long-term, low-cost technology funding solutions to businesses of all shapes and sizes has made the company a leader in the field of independent technology leasing and financing. For technology professionals, DDI can work with you to tailor a solution that eliminates “sticker shock” for potential customers who are evaluating your services.

Presented by: Christian Moscicki, Managing Director, DDI Leasing, Inc.

BNI Chapter 56

Technology Product Development


What to expect:  

Learn how to tap unrealized potential markets in your industry through the use of technology.  How custom software can benefit your business productivity, operations, or help you tap unrealized revenue by scaling the capacities of your team.

Key Points of presentation: 


If you have ever thought your job could be done better or faster.  If you have ever had scaling problems due to the strict limitations of time.  If you have ever thought that there may be untapped potential in your profession, this talk is for you.  

Presented by:  Erek Tinker, Director of Business Development, The Spry Group, LLC 

BNI Chapter 56

One of the biggest issues companies face as they move to offer mobile options to their customers and employees is security and upholding the company wide standards.

Join us to hear from industry leaders about what they are seeing and how they address their customers’ security concerns, and offer advice and actions to take to ensure the security of your apps.

Don't forget, this is an open forum, so bring your questions to ask the experts.

Our panelists include:

Brian Katz - Director, EUC Mobility Strategy, Office of the CTO at VMware 
Before joining VMWare over a year ago Brian was the Director, Head of user Experience and Innovation at Sanofi where he was an Advisor to CTO leadership team on strategic initiatives, a core member of INNOV8 (North American innovation group) and part of the core team responsible for architecture and design for Big Data Initiative around competitive intelligence.

Mark Stutzman – CEO, Appmobi
Mark is new to this position but not to leading companies. In January of 2015, Mark's previous company Digital Variant was acquired by Appmobi. Mark was founder and CEO of Digital Variant, a tech consultancy working with fortune 500's and startups. 

Join us for the Meetup to learn from the best and gain valuable insights from their experience.

results.description:
When: Tuesday, May 17, 2016 from 6-9 p.m.

Where: The Irish Exit, 978 2nd Avenue NY, NY


What: "Open borders" is a term both meaningful and meaningless. At once it conveys visions of countries without lines of demarcation, countries without imperial nationalism, and countries without boundaries we can protect. But that's mostly because most people just don't know much about what "open borders" really means or entails. So let's talk about it! Should our borders be open or closed? What would open borders even look like? Are open borders a threat to our national sovereignty or a necessity for operating as a humane country that's part of a globalized world? Yevgeniy Feyman from the Manhattan Institute will educate us on open borders from a philosophical and policy-based perspective. But because collaboration is the best form of education, we'll all help to educate each other through Q&A and discussion.

Cost: $5, includes drinks and finger food

=======================================

A reservation and pre-payment is required:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/afffee-present-lets-talk-about-open-borders-tickets-18530198322?mc_cid=25b90ae34b&mc_eid=40bf1e2261
results.name: AFF/FEE: Yevgeniy Feyman on What An Open Borders Policy Would Really Mean

results.description:
Please go here to purchase a ticket https://www.eventbrite.com/e/workshop-on-tools-to-build-your-career-through-new-media-channels-tickets-25241760786

Let's face it, the idea of "no need to reinvent the wheel" is not 100% applicable in the age of media. "Embracing" and following a career path on what once worked as a good publicity tool in the age where magazines, newspaper, and TV dominated the media doesn't necessarily work in today's age dominated by the internet, mobile phones, and social media.

At this event we will address adapting to new media platforms and algorithms. While also proving that viral content is not the same as quality content.

Syllabus:

Our presenter will be Paul Rothbein who films 360 content, is part of Summit.Live, and has published Facebook video and photo content that has accumulated to almost 50,000,000 views in only a period of a few months.

Video-

This will be a hands on instruction about to learn about new tools people can use to create content that "wows!" people by utilizing live streaming and virtual reality.

- How to use new content like 360 video, VR, and live streaming where it is more than just a gimmick and why gimmicky content might "wow!" a visitor but not stick.

- How to create online short videos that are engaging and take less than 15 minutes to make and only require a smartphone.

Photos-

- Understanding which Facebook and Instagram photos are the types that not only generate page views but also encourage comments and discussion, and how to create memes that encourage engagement.
results.name: Workshop on Tools to Build Your Career Through New Media Channels

results.description:
Come learn about the future of hospitality technology in this panel discussion, moderated by Krish Jagirdar, Associate at Brand New Matter.

When: Tuesday May[masked], 6 - 8:00pm 
Where: WeWork City Hall at 222 Broadway (entrance on Fulton St), 19th floor 
Cost: Free

Beer will be provided, courtesy of WeWork! (no wine or liquor)

AGENDA:
6 - 6:30pm: Networking 
6:30-7:30pm: Panel discussion
7:30-8:00pm: More networking and wrap-up

Important: The entrance to the building is around the corner on Fulton St, across from the Fulton Center transportation hub.


ABOUT THE PANEL:

Moderator:

Krish Jagirdar is an Entrepreneur and Leadership Team Member specializing in the areas of web and mobile technology operations, product development, sales, and marketing. Previously as a Strategist at Dom & Tom and Founder of Robot Dog, he has worked with startups and Fortune 500 companies alike to help them navigate safely through the digital realm in the most effective ways possible. Now at Brand New Matter, Krish consults entrepreneurs and would-be entrepreneurs about how to successfully launch strong businesses and raise money from investors. 

Panelists:

Steven Rubin is VP Revenue Management at Denihan Hospitality Group, Adjunct Professor—Strategic Pricing and Revenue Management at the NYU Tisch Center, and the founder of TRI Hospitality. Steven brings a deep background in strategic revenue planning, hospitality technology, and the hotel ecosystem.

Justin Kellerman is the General Manager at NOMO SOHO hotel in New York. Previously he has served as GM at The Jade Hotel Greenwich Village, Director of Revenue & Duty Manager at The Mark Hotel, Director of Revenue Management atGrand Hotels NYC, and Director of Business Development at Travel Tripper.


Ben Habbel is the Founder and CEO of Voyat, the leading guest retention software platform for travel companies. Ben works with leading hospitality brands to increase their direct bookings and guest retention. Prior to Voyat, he served as the Chief of Staff to Marissa Mayer at Google, managing communications and special projects.

Caitlin Zaino is the Founder and CEO of Porter & Sail, a provider of digital hospitality solutions for leading hotels. Porter & Sail's products marry leading-edge technology with engaging lifestyle content to ensure deep, organic and actionable guest engagement between hotels and guests.

About our sponsors:


Travel Startups Incubator invests $50,000 in the world's most talented travel entrepreneurs and early stage travel technology ideas ($25,000 USD cash + $25,000 worth of services). Opportunities are available for:

• Travel startups to receive investment, mentoring, business development, and fundraising services

• Corporate partners to access cutting-edge travel technology and ideas 

• Investors to get a first look at the next wave of travel innovation

WeWork is the platform for creators.  We provide the workspace, community, and services you need to make a life, not just a living.  To learn more about the WeWork locations in New York City, click here to book a tour or send an email to [masked].


I hope to see you on May 17!

Michael Coletta
Organizer, Travel 2.0 Meetup Group
Managing Director, Travel Startups Incubator
About: mcoletta.com

results.description:
You're invited to hack along with the New York Linux Users Group!


Please have a government issued form of ID with you.


This is a peer-supported workshop where we get together to share current challenges and approaches to solving problems or to just work alongside like-minded individuals and learn through osmosis.

This event is NOT a lecture-style meeting. The agenda is generally set when someone poses a question, so bring questions!

Some topics up for discussion are:

• Install and configuration assistance

• Documentation, standards, and best practices

• Current events/Conventions

• Release testing and bug reporting

• Getting started with languages like Python and LaTeX

• -Other projects (Pi/Arduino/Analog devices)

We will also have brief (approx. 5-10 minute) lightning talks, so please speak with a coordinator if you're interested in sharing some of your work.

A laptop is not required but strongly recommended.

Bring a project, topic, and questions and work with other enthusiasts on using Linux or get assistance with your own Linux/Open Source projects. Geeks are more sociable solving problems rather then just talking about themselves.

Come masterminding with us at our "Savanting Circle". Savanting Circles are a facilitated, safe place to brainstorm, ask questions, get and give ideas; all in a group of motivated, trailblazing women who are eager to help each other out.

It’s a group of powerful women getting together who UNDERSTAND the power of getting together. This is very important because it brings women together who are in it to win! Most business women face similar challenges. The diverse perspectives from the group enabled the members to gain insight on how to best resolve their issues.

Early on in our entrepreneurial journey we discovered the power of masterminding and it changed our lives and business and we know it will change yours too.

We know that not everyone has $500, $600 or $1,000 to be part of a mastermind group and because of all the amazing, positive growth we’ve seen not only in our business but also that of our members; we whole-heartedly believe that every female entrepreneur needs it as part of her success formula. Savanting Circles are included in our membership and conveniently happen online and live.

*Brainstorm new ideas

*Gain business tools and help each other grow

results.description:
Join us as Mario discusses seed investing and valuation.   Mario is well versed in these areas as he is a Serial Angel Investor and Entrepreneur. He is the Founder of TechLaunch, which in less than 3 years launched 26 startups and mentored over 65 entrepreneurs by providing seed capital, co-working space, a 16 week business boot-camp, a network of over 135 mentors, and access to investors.

In addition Mario is the Founder of Casabona Ventures, providing Business Coaching, Strategic Planning, and seed Financing to over 20 technology enabled early stage companies. He is an active member of Jumpstart New Jersey Angel Network, one of the premier Angel groups in the Mid-Atlantic Region. In 1982 he founded and was CEO of Electro-Radiation Inc. (ERI) until 2004 when ERI was acquired by Honeywell, Aerospace Group. ERI was a developer of Radar, Navigation and Communications equipment for the Defense industry. In 2014 he was named NJ’s Immigrant Entrepreneur of the Year and named one of New Jersey’s top 5 most influential people in Technology by the Star Ledger. In 2013 he was named the Legend of Technology by the New Jersey Technology Council, which in 2010 also awarded him the Financier of the Year. He enjoys serving on several for-profit as well as non-for-profit boards. Mario is an Electrical Engineer and holds 6 national patents in the field of satellite-based navigation and communications. He lives in Morris County, enjoys mentoring, launching new ventures, vacationing and spending casual time with family and friends in his Catskills log home.

Agenda for the evening is as follows:


6:30 to 7:00 Pizza & Networking


7:00 to 7:10 Updates

7:10 to 7:20 Audience/Member Announcements and Requests

7:20 to 7:30 Startup Pitch #1


7:40 to 7:50 Startup Pitch #2


7:50 to 8:30 Keynote speaker:  Mario Casabona

8:30 to 9:00 Networking

After 9:00   Drinks at Vanderbilt's in the Hamilton Park Hotel https://maps.google.com/maps?expflags%3Denable_star_based_justifications:true%26ie%3DUTF8%26cid%3D16356950445471689601%26q%3DHamilton%2BPark%2BHotel%2B%2526%2BConference%2BCenter%26iwloc%3DA%26gl%3DUS%26hl%3Den">175 Park Ave Florham Park, NJ 07932 - Just exit through the Florham Road / Park Ave exit of FDU and you will see the Hotel on the left before you reach Park Ave. 

Directions - Complete directions to the FDU library are available here - http://view.fdu.edu/files/directionstolibrarymonningercenterandorangerie.pdf

Parking - Park behind the library, across from of the dorms or in one of the larger (but further) lots. See the parking map below.

Singles Bingo with Scorecard Matching to keep in touch with those you are interested in! 


How does it work? 

This will be a casual event. We will be playing Bingo for prizes. It's more of a mingle with some fun ice breakers! 

2-3 men and 2-3 women will be sitting together at each station. Approximately every ten minutes, the men will shift over to the next station and continue playing. This ensures that you will get to meet everyone at the event.

What if I'm interested in someone? 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

Where do I get tickets?

Tickets are $20-$30 depending upon how early you purchase at 

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own.

And don't worry, you're not required to get technical. Meteor is new, and we're learning together.

Curtis Larson – Meteor + Apollo & GraphQL!

This month, Curtis Larson will give an introduction to using Apollo & GraphQL with Meteor & React! The focus will be on integrating different types of databases with maximum code re-use and show a new way of using reactive Meteor data with React.

Curtis Larson is a NYC-based freelance full stack developer with extensive experience in MeteorJS. He's available for hire at www.curtismlarson.com. You can read more about this topic and other Meteor-related adventures at his blog.

results.description:
Join us May 17th at 6:30pm to hear Jake Hofman, Senior Researcher at Microsoft Research, give his talk: How Predictable is information diffusion?

Food and drinks will be provided.

How Predictable is Information Diffusion?
How does information spread in online social networks and how predictable are online diffusion events? Despite a great deal of existing research on modeling information diffusion and predicting success in social systems, these questions have remained largely unanswered for a variety of reasons. These reasons range from the inability to observe most word-of-mouth communication, to difficulties in precisely and consistently formalizing different notions of success. 

This talk will attempt to clarify these issues through an empirical analysis of billions of diffusion events under one simple but unified framework. Jake will show that despite stable regularities in aggregate diffusion patterns, it remains surprisingly difficult to predict the success of any particular individual or piece of content in an online social network – with his best performing models explaining only half of the empirical variance in outcomes. He'll conclude by exploring this limit theoretically through a series of simulations that suggest that it is the diffusion process itself, rather than our ability to estimate or model it, that is responsible for this unpredictability.


Speaker Bio:
Jake Hofman is a Senior Researcher at Microsoft Research in New York City, where his work in computational social science involves applications of statistics and machine learning to large-scale social data. Prior to joining Microsoft, he was a member of the Microeconomics and Social Systems group at Yahoo! Research. Jake is also an Adjunct Assistant Professor of Applied Mathematics at Columbia University, where he has designed and taught classes on a number of topics ranging from biological physics to applied machine learning. He holds a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Boston University and a Ph.D. in Physics from Columbia University.
results.name: 'How Predictable is Information Diffusion?' with Jake Hofman, Microsoft Research

Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!

results.description:
Behavior change products are simultaneously compelling and incredibly difficult to build. For example, how does a product teach users a new language, or even healthy habits that will make them lose weight? Based on the works of prominent behavioral economists, we'll cover the thought process that leads a user to take action and how to foster it. We'll also learn strategies that you can apply to the product design process to help your users change their lives.

Presenter from Noom:

Logan Merriam, Product Designer

Logan is a product designer at Noom Inc, where he builds products that help patients of chronic disease reverse their conditions through behavior change. Prior to that he was lead designer at Kinsa Inc, tracking the spread of disease using a smartphone-based thermometer. Logan also created and currently runs flaredown.com, a community of people with incurable chronic illness learning to analyze their treatments and fix their symptoms.

About Our Sponsor:

Lifion, by ADP, invites you to visit our new home for big ideas, ambitious folks, and those who are truly committed to delivering finely made products at scale. Join us after-hours for provocative talks, engaging discussions and some great opportunities to connect with serious thinkers and doers. Visit us at www.lifion.com for a calendar of upcoming events and current job opportunities. We look forward to meeting you soon!
results.name: Designing Human Behavior: The Basics of Habit-Forming Product Design

results.description:
Anupam Sengupta, Co-Founder & CTO, GuardHat

Free USB sticks, beer & drinks, junk food plus win a Kindle Fire HD6!

A Database Month event http://www.DBMonth.com/database/iot-big-data

Over 4,000 U.S. workers die on the job every year, and more than 3 million get injured. New wearable technologies are aggressively entering consumer applications (Fitbit, Skully, Apple Watch) but industrial safety equipment has not seen any fundamental innovation in the last decade.

GuardHat addresses this issue with its "smart hard hat ecosystem", essentially an IoT device in a hard hat form factor. GuardHat is an industrial wearable that uses IoT and wireless communications systems to protect and empower industrial workers. By collecting and analyzing sensor-based data, GuardHat blends existing and emerging technologies to prevent safety incidents and to intervene more effectively when incidents happen.

The GuardHat ecosystem includes a comprehensive Big Data software platform that gathers large volumes of sensor and M2M data, and analyzes this data stream in real-time using a Complex Event Processing engine to detect and act upon potential safety events. The architecture is modular and scalable to address future application integrations and flexibility in deployment. Reliability and performance are key, and the dynamic nature of the usage scenarios dictates the need for a rapid development toolset, all of which are addressed by HPCC Systems.

The GuardHat open platform can also deploy additional applications involving real-time access to the front line workforce. Preliminary analyses indicate that up to 20% of severe incidents could be prevented by GuardHat which is a potential market-value savings of $30-50 billion per year based on U.S. businesses incurring over $250 billion in annual safety related costs.

Anupam Sengupta, Co-Founder & CTO, GuardHat Anupam is a co-founder and the CTO of GuardHat. Previously, Anupam served as the CIO of Severstal North America, a subsidiary of OAO Severstal, a global metals and mining company. At Severstal NA, Anupam managed over $15 million of IT/technology annual projects and operations, and lead the successful divestiture and new integration of the IT assets and systems in September 2014 to AK Steel and Steel Dynamics.

Anupam joined Severstal from Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), the world's fourth largest IT/Technology consulting firm, where he served as a Senior Consultant in the Banking and Financials practice.

Anupam has over 18 years of extensive and cross-functional experience in Enterprise Information Technology and Consulting. In his last role with TCS, Anupam served as the client partner at PNC Bank, the sixth largest retail bank in the U.S., where he managed a 900-person team of architects, managers, developers and engineers in an $80 million portfolio of systems and IT infrastructure. Anupam has global technology expertise with substantial work experience across Europe, Asia and North America.

He has worked in the past with American Express, Ameriprise Financial, Deutsche Bank and Toyota Financial Services in various technology and management leadership roles. He holds an undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology in India.

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

Did you know that Techie Youth is the ONE-AND-ONLY organization providing career-opportunities to severely-at-risk foster-youth in New York?

Techie Youth is a 501c3 not-for-profit charity of NYC that provides technology-education, followed by assistance beginning an IT-career, to at-risk youth in NYC & Long Island who are in foster-care and classified as being severely-at-risk of becoming homeless and/or incarcerated in the next 18-24 months.

These kids need YOU, they have nobody else.
Please help them. Donate now at http://www.TechieYouth.org/donate
(saving a child's life is very easy!)

results.description:
Co-Hosted by NYC Open Data meetup and NYC Data Science Academy meetup.

*** Apply for 12-week full-time Data Science bootcamp program to be a Data Scientist , next offering is from July 5th to Sept 23rd, 2016 *** 

=====================================

This event is co-hosted with NYC Data Science Academy.

======================================

Welcome to our Shiny Apps Demo day. Our 12-week data science bootcamp students will present the Shiny Interactive Apps that they build at 4th week of the program. These little interactive apps that are created in R are great ways of manipulating and visualizing data. This demo event has always been fun and a favorite of our community. Food and drinks are provided! Please Enjoy!

Presenters TBA.


++++++++++++++++++++++++

1. Exploring 2015 World University Rankings

By Ho Fai Wong


Several organizations such as the ARWU, THE and CWUR score and rank universities across the globe. What were the ‘best’ universities in the world in 2015? How do these results differ by ranking organization? This Shiny application attempts to explore these and other questions related to the 2015 world university rankings.

2. Cost of Living Estimator Between Cities

By Joseph Wang


In the past few years, I have traveled across the country as a postdoctoral and industrial researcher. This is in part due to the harshness of the permanent academic environment, and also the down turn in the energy industry, especially back in my home town of Houston, Texas. The most immediately need for my family is to look for a new job opportunity near an area which is affordable for long term living. It occurs to me that it would be great to have a Shiny application in R, which will be useful for people who want to or need to relocate. My goal is to show some facts that may go against intuition about how things should work on the matter of cost of living standards and salary ranges in different cities. On the other hand, I also would like to examine if the income for data scientists is paid fairly according to living standards, and hopefully make a suggestion on top cities for data scientists in terms of realistic aspects of life.


3. Food and health demographics in the USA

By Yannick Kimmel


Obesity affects roughly 1 in 3 Americans, while diabetes affects roughly 1 in 10 Americans. The scope of this project is to explore the relationship of food and economic factors in the US' counties. Data was taken from the USDA's Food Environment Atlas. The diversity (or variance) of factors across counties allows for correlations in obesity rates to be developed. Users can map health indicators across the US, explore the relationship among different factors, and predict how changes in demographic factors will affect obesity rates.


4. New York City Cultural Institutions

By Robert Castellano

Robert created a Shiny app that gives organizes the information of cultural institutions in New York. This is designed to both connect users with the institutions they are interested in, as well as discover greater trends in culture across the city.


5. NYC Complaints by Borough

By Kelly Mejia Breton

NYC Complaints by Borough is a quick reference tool to aid users with their planning, grounded on the complaints reported in NYC.

6. Panama Papers


By Ruonan Ding


The International Consortium of Investigative Journalists releases on May 9, 2016 a searchable database with information on more than 200,000 offshore entities that are part of the Panama Papers investigation. The data comes from the Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca, one of the top players in the offshore world, and includes information about companies, trusts, foundations and funds incorporated in 21 tax havens, from Hong Kong to Nevada in the United States. It links to people in more than 200 countries and territories.

See more at: http://shiny.nycdatascience.com/

Singles Bingo with Scorecard Matching to keep in touch with those you are interested in! 


How does it work? 

This will be a casual event. We will be playing Bingo for prizes. It's more of a mingle with some fun ice breakers! 

2-3 men and 2-3 women will be sitting together at each station. Approximately every ten minutes, the men will shift over to the next station and continue playing. This ensures that you will get to meet everyone at the event.

What if I'm interested in someone? 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

Where do I get tickets?

Tickets are $20-$30 depending upon how early you purchase at 

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30? This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+.

results.description:
America did a pretty good job from[masked] - getting out of the Depression without a revolution, winning WWII, penning Stalin behind the Iron Curtain, creating a suburban paradise and establishing Pax Americana.  Was one of the reasons that our politics were not stuck in partisan gridlock? Or was that golden bipartisan age a myth?  

Next we see if the politics of that era helped America reach its zenith. We'll look for lessons we can learn for our own times.

So if you have an opinion about packing the Supreme Court vs. unpacking it like now, America First 1.0, Donald Trump as the new Wendell Willkie, the relative guilt of Alger Hiss vs. the Rosenbergs or liking Ike, bring it along.
results.name: When America Worked - New Deal, WWII, Postwar Boom

results.description:
To RSVP fill out the form here --->>> http://eepurl.com/btziMb

Learn How to Get out of the Rat Race in Real Life!

Cashflow 101 is a fun way to learn the basic concepts of Real estate Investing. Your objective throughout the night will be to get out of the rat race and into the fast track! In other words you have to find a way to get out of that 9-5 and step into the life you always wanted to live, the strategies learned in the game can be applied in real life! We're going to show you how me and my team play cashflow in real life and how we help people implement these strategies to get out of the rat race.

How do you get out of the race race you ask?

Your total monthly passive income has to be higher than your total monthly expenses, you're going to learn the importance of acquiring assets vs stacking up liabilities and how you will be able to use your money wisely instead of just using it to pay bills. We're going to show you practical strategies you can use in your life today that will change your perspective about investing and we will shatter some of the myths people have about money.

Cashflow 101 is an educational tool in board game format which aims to teach the players concepts of investing by having their money work for them in a risk free setting (play money) while simultaneously increasing financial literacy and stressing the imperative nature of accountability.


If you have ever played monopoly this game is like monopoly on steroids!  If you're serious about learning and expanding your knowledge about investing in real estate DON'T MISS THIS EVENT!

To RSVP fill out the form here --->>> http://eepurl.com/btziMb
results.name: Cashflow 101- learn how to get out of the rat race in real life!

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.
