results.description:
Promoting Veganism in NYC - Union Square Park - SW corner of the park at East 14th Street & Union Square West. Look for the "Veg Meetup" sign.


Our meetup group has historically been a social group. (With the subtle activist mission of promoting veganism by showing people how much fun it can be.) In recent years we've done an occasional event that was directly an activist event, but these have been few and far between.

While we are, and will continue to be, mostly a social group, we'd like to step up the number of activist events we do.


This May 17th event will be outreach to the general public to promote and encourage a vegan diet & lifestyle. We will hand out literature in a welcoming manner so our audience will be open to seeing how great the benefits of veganism are for people, the non-human animals who share our world, and the planet itself.


We will meet at the southwest corner of the park itself (East 14th Street and Union Square West, right on the corner of the park block) in Union Square at 6:30 pm (please arrive on time!). After a brief discussion on strategy and positioning of people, along with a few reminders for the group, we'll leaflet from 6:45 pm to 7:45 pm. Then our group will reassemble at the park corner and walk over to a nearby, all-vegan restaurant to have dinner, discuss our experiences and thoughts, and socialize.

We know that not everyone in our group is vegan, but on this day we will be promoting veganism. You are very welcome to join us even if you are not yet 100% vegan, but please understand that the literature we will hand out will promote a purely vegan lifestyle. Mostly on this day you will be handing out literature rather than talking to people, but if you do happen to speak with people, we are promoting a vegan diet and lifestyle for their tremendous benefits.

Where to meet: We will be meeting at the extreme southwest corner of Union Square Park, where Union Square West meets East 14th Street. We'll meet on the actual park block, right on the corner. You will see us holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign. We will meet right at 6:30pm. You may want to plan on being there early in order to be on time. Don't be late! We will talk for 15 minutes and then disburse to various nearby locations in the park.


We believe that grass-roots activism is vital in advancing the ideal, practice, and potential normalization of veganism in our world. So let's come together and do this, and also have fun while doing it!


Thank You All

Saurabh Dalal and David Greene

results.name: Promoting Veganism in NYC - Union Square Park

results.description:
GE's innovative platform, Intelligent Environment for Cities, uses LED street lighting and wireless sensors to connect, collect, and analyze data harnessing the power of the Industrial Internet to enhance quality of life for city residents and visitors. Our intelligent LED systems are a gateway to city changing technology, with sensors, controls, wireless transmitters, and microprocessors built within the LED system. Predix, our cloud platform for the Industrial Internet, collects and analyzes data from these components to deliver optimized tools that respond to city challenges.

About Jason:

Jason Whittet is a Director with GE’s Intelligent Cities team deploying smart, connected LED lighting with sensors and data analytics.  Most recently, Jason worked with the International Data Corporation’s (IDC) public sector practice where he led local, state and federal government business development for the global technology research and advisory firm.  Before IDC, he helped launch the Massachusetts Broadband Institute as Deputy Director and contributed to the successful completion of the $100MM, 1,200 mile MassBroadband 123 fiber-optic network in western Massachusetts.  Jason has also held positions with Comcast in government relations, with the Massachusetts State Senate Ways and Means Committee as Project Director, and with the Allston-Brighton Community Development Corporation as an AmeriCorps Volunteer.  Jason has a Bachelor of Science from Arizona State University and a Master’s in Public Administration from Northeastern.
results.name: Intelligent Environment for Cities w/Current powered by GE

venue.address_1: 55 Fifth Avenue (btwn 12th/13th Streets), New York, NY
venue.name: Cardozo Law School, Rm 407

results.description:
Hi All --

For our second Open Source Legal Meetup, we are going to hear from Joe Mornin and then dig in on automating a transaction! 

Joe Mornin (www.mornin.org/) will join us remotely to speak on Law, Open Source and Software.  Joe is a practicing lawyer who spends his free time writing code for projects, many of which are legal related and open source.  See https://github.com/morninj.

In a previous Jam Session with NY Legal Hackers, we scripted and automated the term sheet from TechStars Open Sourced Model Seed Financing Documents (http://www.techstars.com/docs/).  The scripted term sheet is available on GitHub here: https://github.com/valcuco/series-aa-preferred-stock-financing-corporation-v1_0_0.  We will continue this project to automate the remainder of the documents.

The automated transaction we create will remain automated and open-sourced on valcu.co.

We intend to work, collaboratively, on a formal process of thinking through scripting transactional docs, then using those scripted docs for a startup company.  We will split up the TechStars documents and comb through how to script them in small groups, then review together.  Please bring your computing devices! MS Word is a plus!

We are particularly interested in having you join us if you have expertise or knowledge in corporate law, investments, and the TechStars docs themselves.

Please note that space is limited. We will see you there!
results.name: Joe Mornin & Automating TechStars Investment Docs

This month, Todd is hosting our meetup at Casual Thai, a cozy and authentically decorated restaurant on Tenth and Washington. Casual Thai offers a wide range of selections, including traditional noodle-based dishes, flavorful hot curries, chef's specials, vegetarian entrees, soups, salads, and delectable appetizers. Prices range from $12 to $18 for entrees and from $5 to $8 for appetizers.

Check out the menu here: www.casual-thai.com

Casual Thai does not have a liquor license, but is BYOB, so you are welcome to bring your own wine or beer, which may be purchased at nearby Yash Wines and Liquors (1004 Washington St.). Last time very few people brought their own wine or beer, so please be sure to bring your favorite drink this time!! I'm going to!!

Thanks, Todd, for being our host at what's sure to be an enjoyable  outing. Looking forward to seeing "regulars" and newcomers alike.

Rock legend Marianne Lane (Swinton) is recuperating on the volcanic island of Pantelleria with her partner Paul (Schoenaerts) when iconoclast record producer and old flame Harry (Fiennes) unexpectedly arrives with his daughter Penelope (Johnson) and interrupts their holiday, bringing with him an A-bomb blast of nostalgia from which there can be no rescue. Luca Guadagnino's (I Am Love) loose remake of Jacques Deray’s La Piscine is a sensuous portrait of desire, jealousy, and rock and roll under the Mediterranean sun.

results.description:
LEARN TO BECOME THE BANK!!

Marc Gold is the former Managing Director and Fund Manager for the American Home Recovery Fund.  AHRF was a private equity fund focusing on acquiring and liquidating non-and-under performing first mortgages from 2011 through end of year 2015. As a fund manager, Marc became frustrated with the lack of attention servicers donated to"managing or handled" non-performing assets.  As such, Marc started putting together the components to help small to mid size note investors become more successful with their investment objectives, no matter the size of the portfolio


In Q2, Marc launched AssetWERX. AssetWerx provides cutting edge full service loss mitigation, collection and foreclosure management services including screening for Hardest Hit Funds awards as well as Non-recourse financing for NPL purchases or refinances.


Marc speaks at many industry events and is regarded as an industry expert with over 25 years in the real estate finance sector.

RSVP to save your space.


These are just some of the topics that will be covered and we will hold an open Q&A at the end of each Meetup.  Our goal is that you understand this information well enough that you will be able to apply it on future purchases or with your existing portfolio.  

HOST:
This event is being hosted by Mahir Allan of MJS Financial 


TIME IS PRECIOUS: Event is from 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like. 

ADMISSION: *Conference Call Access Requires RSVP*  This event is limited to a max of 30 people.

- FREE - First 25 RSVP 
- $10 - 26 - 30 People

This week I am going to see Money Monster I will arrive at 7:00 for the 7:30 pm showing. I  have seat D8 If you are coming post your seat #  If anyone wants to go to the Red Oak Diner after the movie meetup again in the lobby after the show.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

results.description:
Sleep now my child

The moon’s rising high

The mother is watching

Her babes where they lie

She’s guarding them closely

In their warm bed

From the wolf and the whisper

And the call of the dead


The liar’s house is fallen, its walls crumbled into ruin and the cellars lost beneath the Magrevian forest. Tase Popov and Grunger must deliver the body of their fallen Paladin to the temple at Grotse Delchev, and tell of the hero who gave his life to protect a family's souls. Meanwhile, beneath the earth Anorrah Eolorahn and Damian are lost in the dark cellars, their vampiric guide departed without them. But they too seek the most northern town of Magrevia, and the secrets it holds for them. As for Stel, who knows what dreams she has, caught in the Seelie dreaming?


In the foothills of the Buchen mountains Grotse Delchev sits, the snows settling on its roofs. Centurion Marcellus Divarus paces the walls and thinks of events three years hence, when he and his men were trapped in that ancient hall. For a moment he pauses to consider the fate of his strange companions, but he has more pressing concerns. A scouting party have just returned, and with them news that chills his blood. 

The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. 

A child’s lullaby is a storyline for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, for characters of 3-5th level. The focus is on solving mysteries, and the challenge of surviving the horror surrounding you.
results.name: D&D 5E - A Child's Lullaby by Tom Gilbert (session 4)

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
Thanks to all who could make Tuesday's talk and reading - Seek Not to Change The World, I've included a small video clip from the session below 


https://youtu.be/Rmax4Jjhvfs

During our sharing, we discussed the way the mind creates "conditions for happiness". If our lives don't seem to meet these made up "conditions" we always feel like we're missing out on God's Joy - which is ever present. However, the Course teaches us that We rule our mind. 

Lesson 236 - I rule my mind, which I alone must rule.


I have a kingdom I must rule. At times, it does not seem I am its king at all. It seems to triumph over me, and tell me what to think, and what to do and feel. And yet it has been given me to serve whatever purpose I perceive in it. My mind can only serve. Today I give its service to the Holy Spirit to employ as He sees fit. I thus direct my mind, which I alone can rule. And thus I set it free to do the Will of God.

Father, my mind is open to Your Thoughts, and closed today to every thought but Yours. I rule my mind, and offer it to You. Accept my gift, for it is Yours to me.


We hope you'll join us this coming Tuesday at 7pm as we explore this powerful lesson - "I rule my mind". We're happy and honored to have your presence.  


Please RSVP before Tuesday, 5/17 to attend our next meeting.
results.name: ACIM - I Rule my Mind

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.

We'll be taking over the space at 7:00 sharp, and the evening should be in full swing by 7:10!  (Latecomers are still welcome, of course.)

Writers, if you're bringing something to present, don't forget to bring ample COMPLETE and IDENTICAL copies of the scene(s) --- one copy for each actor you'll need, plus one copy for a reader of any stage directions.  (And if you're able to provide character descriptions in the form of a breakdown appended as page 1 --- that's never a bad idea. :))

Actors, come ready to read!

results.description:
IFTTT is an acronym for IF T-his T-hen T-hat. 

It's a free web-based service that enables you to connect numerous software and hardware platforms, and automate actions based on the rules for those connections. 

The good news is, in depth programming knowledge is not required. IFTTT handles all the heavy lifting. 

For example, you can create a new post and configure IFTTT to automatically tweet that same image via your connected Twitter account.

Put another way, IFTTT is your best-friend, personal assistant, and trusted robot all wrapped into one.  

The crux of this talk will focus on various examples for using IFTTT as a WP designer and\or WP developer.. There will also be a section of the talk dedicated to IFTTT combined with Buffer, as a content marketing automation tool.

PRESENTED BY: Mark Simchock

OPENING PRESENTATION:  Hidden benefits of the Custom Facebook Feed Plugin

With over 200,000 installs, the Custom Facebook Feed plugin by Smashballoon, has many benefits for your site.  In this presentation we will explore the most important settings and advantages, and how some "side effects" will improve your positioning, speed and other aspects of your site.

PRESENTED BY: Diego Maslo

ABOUT THE PRESENTERS:


Mark F. Simchock is the Chief Alchemist of Alchemy United. He's been using WordPress since late 2007. He enjoys writing code but is just as intrigued by marketing and its twin user experience. 

His current WP-centric side projects include: WPezDeveloper, WPezClasses, WPezBoilerStrap

Additional creations not related to WP include: ReadLearnAdapt - The #BusinessMinded #BookClub, Cafe 1099 - A new Meetup for 1099'ers, ezWebDevTools

Diego Maslo has worked for the last 8 years with WordPress and most of the principal themes & plugins vendors. He has been an ElegantThemes Support team member, and is currently a Codeable expert, a WPML official contractor, and help in support and development at SmashBalloon.com.

He is also the Founder & CEO of Corewpress, a WordPress consultancy and development company and of Latamis a Media Research company.
results.name: WordPress and IFTTT

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

****This event is in no way trying to endorse or push any political party or motive.  It is strictly posted to provide members and friends the opportunity to engage in the political process and discussion with others.  If you think you may be too passionate in your views this may not be an event for you.  We will host similar events for other candidates as they are scheduled****** 

In the August presidential debates we watch Donald Trump complained that Fox news Megyn Kelly had treated him unfairly, the Republican front runner also accused Kelly of being "sick" and "overrated," and implied that she was a "bimbo."  Now they will sit face to face in a one on one interview.  Join us for what is sure to be an interesting evening.  We will have the private 3rd floor party room reserved just for our group.  The interview will be shown on 3 monitors with the sound on.

Here is how it works:

-Arrive anytime after 7pm (come earlier if you wish to eat with others. Separate checks no problem)

-Socialize, eat and drink.

-At 8pm we will turn on the televisions for the interview.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

Do I need to be a Republican to attend?  NO!  This event is strictly meant to showcase the different candidates.  We will have similar events for other candidates/political parties

Dress code: Business casual
results.name: Trump Interview with Megyn Kelly Primetime Special

We will meet and practice Zhineng(wisdom) Qigong level 1 exercises

Cost nominal $5 to cover room rental

Our excellent practice leader Ethan will lead the practice of Lift Qi Up Pour Qi Down

Then I will share my experience with holding 10 workshops in Lahore(Pakistan). I will teach Roufu, a simple but powerful exercise to build Dantian Qi

I will also share a self healing exercise to improve eye sight.  This healing exercise is great to show the immediate benefit of nourishing Qigong.

These exercises remove blockages in our energetic system and increase Qi.

The benefits are: Stronger Health, Stable Emotions and Extraordinary Capability

About 15-18 people show up every meeting. We have been meeting for about four(4) months. We also have guest speaker nights. Where we invite high level masters from around the world. China/Malaysia/California

Edgar Cayce Center has a comfortable waiting area, w/ free coffee, tea, water. Please arrive 10-15 mintues before the event, meet our practice leader Ethan and other members

All the best

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.
results.how_to_find_us: We’re on the second floor of the building in the far end
results.name: Tech Tuesday Open House at Hack Manhattan

results.description:
Join us as Adam Zachar shares with us stories from the PAC (Penn Aerospace Club).

The Penn Aerospace Club (PAC) is a student-lead organization at the University of Pennsylvania, founded in 2014 to build a vibrant aerospace community on campus. We engage our members through engineering projects, student-led seminars, industry events, and more.

Our projects range from rocketry, to space balloons, to custom fixed-wing drones. Our members’ talks cover both detailed technical papers and general introductions to the industry, to excite more of Penn’s campus about aerospace.

We are the go-to organization for both students and industry recruiters who want to work with the best aerospace talent Penn has to offer.

Learn more at http://pennaero.com/

The NYIT Incubator can be tricky to find. Avoid asking the front desk and try using this map instead: https://goo.gl/yjyCsS
results.how_to_find_us: NYIT Incubator, fourth floor, end of the hall conference room.
results.name: Penn Aerospace Club with Adam Zachar, a #SpaceTalk

We all have dreams of abundance. But so many of us, whether we know it or not, have piss poor theories about wealth and money that are stifling our dreams and sabotaging our success. Come to this eye-opening event and get your mind and money under new management. You will learn to connect your thoughts, feelings, and actions to produce the results you deeply desire.


Many of us, whether we know it or not, have bad theories about wealth and money that are negatively impacting our dreams. Join expert coach Laurie Gerber at the JCC in Manhattan for a 2-hour event where you will deal with your money and learn to connect your thoughts, feelings, and actions to produce the results you deeply desire.


You are welcome to bring a pen and pad for possible exercises.

results.description:
Co-Hosted by NYC Open Data meetup and NYC Data Science Academy meetup.

*** Apply for 12-week full-time Data Science bootcamp program to be a Data Scientist , next offering is from July 5th to Sept 23rd, 2016 *** 

=====================================

This event is co-hosted with NYC Data Science Academy.

======================================

Welcome to our Shiny Apps Demo day. Our 12-week

data science bootcamp

students will present the Shiny Interactive Apps that they build at 4th week of the program. These little interactive apps that are created in R are great ways of manipulating and visualizing data. This demo event has always been fun and a favorite of our community. Food and drinks are provided! Please Enjoy!

Presenters TBA.

++++++++++++++++++++++++

Co-Hosted by NYC Open Data meetup and NYC Data Science Academy meetup.

*** Apply for 12-week full-time Data Science bootcamp program to be a Data Scientist , next offering is from July 5th to Sept 23rd, 2016 *** 

=====================================

This event is co-hosted with NYC Data Science Academy.

======================================

Welcome to our Shiny Apps Demo day. Our 12-week data science bootcamp students will present the Shiny Interactive Apps that they build at 4th week of the program. These little interactive apps that are created in R are great ways of manipulating and visualizing data. This demo event has always been fun and a favorite of our community. Food and drinks are provided! Please Enjoy!

Presenters TBA.

++++++++++++++++++++++++

1. Exploring 2015 World University Rankings

By Ho Fai Wong

Several organizations such as the ARWU, THE and CWUR score and rank universities across the globe. What were the ‘best’ universities in the world in 2015? How do these results differ by ranking organization? This Shiny application attempts to explore these and other questions related to the 2015 world university rankings.

2. Cost of Living Estimator Between Cities

By Joseph Wang

In the past few years, I have traveled across the country as a postdoctoral and industrial researcher. This is in part due to the harshness of the permanent academic environment, and also the down turn in the energy industry, especially back in my home town of Houston, Texas. The most immediately need for my family is to look for a new job opportunity near an area which is affordable for long term living. It occurs to me that it would be great to have a Shiny application in R, which will be useful for people who want to or need to relocate. My goal is to show some facts that may go against intuition about how things should work on the matter of cost of living standards and salary ranges in different cities. On the other hand, I also would like to examine if the income for data scientists is paid fairly according to living standards, and hopefully make a suggestion on top cities for data scientists in terms of realistic aspects of life.

3. Food and health demographics in the USA

By Yannick Kimmel

Obesity affects roughly 1 in 3 Americans, while diabetes affects roughly 1 in 10 Americans. The scope of this project is to explore the relationship of food and economic factors in the US' counties. Data was taken from the USDA's Food Environment Atlas. The diversity (or variance) of factors across counties allows for correlations in obesity rates to be developed. Users can map health indicators across the US, explore the relationship among different factors, and predict how changes in demographic factors will affect obesity rates.

4. New York City Cultural Institutions

By Robert Castellano

Robert created a Shiny app that gives organizes the information of cultural institutions in New York. This is designed to both connect users with the institutions they are interested in, as well as discover greater trends in culture across the city.

5. NYC Complaints by Borough

By Kelly Mejia Breton

NYC Complaints by Borough is a quick reference tool to aid users with their planning, grounded on the complaints reported in NYC.

6. Panama Papers

By Ruonan Ding

The International Consortium of Investigative Journalists releases on May 9, 2016 a searchable database with information on more than 200,000 offshore entities that are part of the Panama Papers investigation. The data comes from the Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca, one of the top players in the offshore world, and includes information about companies, trusts, foundations and funds incorporated in 21 tax havens, from Hong Kong to Nevada in the United States. It links to people in more than 200 countries and territories.


See more at: http://shiny.nycdatascience.com/
results.name: R Shiny Demo Day

results.description:
We recently lost another Irish pub in New York, Dempsey's in the East Village. But the legendary Tuesday night session at Dempsey's has continued on around the corner at Sláinte, so please join us there on this night.

The Dempsey's session has been bringing musicians together every Tuesday night for the last two decades to play traditional Irish music together round-robin style (musicians taking turns starting tunes). All are welcome, from beginners to professionals. Spectators have always been welcome as well.

Now the tradition of the Dempsey's session continues at Sláinte, a great neighborhood Irish pub in its own right. Meet starting at 7 for drinks, food and conversation, the music starts at 8. If you play an instrument, bring it and sit in with the session, you'll be most welcome.

See you there!
results.name: Dempsey's Session in Residence at Sláinte

group.name: The New York Irish Pub Challenge Meetup

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds/credit: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund, please provide the Paypal Transaction ID: 18D76937M[masked]R No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W 77th street): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors, check for pictures. the door is closed but unlocked, report to our security and go to the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Help us to post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

******PLEASE NOTE: TGI FRIDAYS CLOSES AT MIDNIGHT, SO LET'S ALL MAKE SURE TO BE OUT BEFORE THEN & NOT OVERSTAY OUR WELCOME.******

Come join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup.

We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Carcassonne & Ticket to Ride to Zombicide & heavier Eurogames! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our gracious hosts, you MUST purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play, feel free to ask. I am sure between us all, we should have it.

-------------------------------------

We always welcome new people & we're all here to have fun, but we do have a few ground rules that we ask everyone to be aware of:

- Treat everyone in the group with respect & do not discriminate. Some of us "trash talk" when we play, but it's all in good fun & in the spirit of gaming.

- This is a restaurant/bar so accidents are bound to happen. However, if you're responsible for ruining someone else's game by spilling a beverage or food on it, the right thing to do is to offer to purchase a new copy for them. Some of the games we bring are out of print so please treat every board game with respect.

- If a game is accidentally ruined by a staff member, everyone at the table should pitch in to buy a new one for the owner. More often than not, this comes to about $10/person or less, so in our opinion it isn't too much to ask for.

Thanks everyone & see you on Tuesday night!

results.description:
Join NYC 50+ Let's Get Social as we mourn and celebrate the life and music of Prince.

Prince transformed how we understand music. A musical genius and iconic artist, he transcended boundaries of genre, gender, race, fashion, and culture. It's hard to find any artist or music fan who wasn't influenced by His Royal Badness. 

Join Touré, author of "I Would Die 4 U: Why Prince Became An Icon," CNN commentator and image activist Michaela Angela Davis, music critic and Burnt Sugar Arkestra founder Greg Tate and lead guitarist, songwriter and founder of Living Colour Vernon Reid as we remember an artist who did not shy away from controversy, contradictions and constant surprises during a career of more than 35 years.

Produced and hosted by Warrington Hudlin, president of the Black Filmmaker Foundation.

Afterward, a DJ will help us celebrate some of his biggest, baddest hits.

Duration:  Two Hours

Tickets:  $15 which includes a complimentary drink.

Everyone will be responsible for purchasing their own ticket.  Tickets can be purchased here:

https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe/10089270 

I will be there at 6:30-6:45.  For those of us who are assembled at that time we will go into the auditorium to be seated.  The venue has General Admission seating only. If you find that you are running late I will not be able to hold a seat for you.  It's also a good bet that we will not all be able to sit together.  This event is likely to sell out so please do not wait to purchase your ticket.

Questions?  Please text me at[masked] or email me at [masked].  Looking forward to seeing some of you on May 17!

Note: due to building security policies, attendees must RSVP 24 hours in advance (by Monday at 7:00PM), and must arrive at the event before 8:00PM on Tuesday.

Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Moat

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

results.description:
At our May monthly meeting we'll be featuring the following presentations:

Bruce Mittelman will give a demonstration of the Nik Collection plug-in suite. This free suite of six powerful plug-ins for Photoshop, Lightroom and Aperture, allows you to easily create the photos you've imagined.

Mark Astmann will give a presentation of Keyboard Maestro, the powerful application that enables you to automate almost any repetitive task you do on you Mac.


Jerry Glacken will give a demonstration of Onionshare, the open source tool that lets you securely and anonymously share a file of any size by leveraging the power of the Tor network.

Louis Perez will give another installment of his popular "Magical Mystery Tour of the Web", which showcases a collection of interesting websites on a given topic. This month's tour will focus on "2016 Television Technology".

George Ajjan will give another installment of "Three Things To Know On Your Mac " in which he'll show interesting tips and tricks that anyone can use to improve their Macintosh workflows.

Plus we'll discuss all of the latest Apple news and have our "Question & Answer" session where our experts will try to solve your problems.

As always, a meeting you won't want to miss! Hope to see you all there!

About NJMUG: 

The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (NJMUG) is open to all persons, whether they are a current or future Macintosh user. An individual membership in NJMUG costs $30.00 per year. If you are thinking of becoming an NJMUG member but would like to check the group out first, we allow non-members to attend two meetings as a "guest". Once you become a member of NJMUG you are entitled to attend all monthly meetings as well as gain access to all of the member benefits including member discounts on hardware and software, free USB flash drive, monthly distribution files, and eligibility in all raffles and member giveaways.  Check www.njmug.org for more information.

results.description:
What: The Censored 11: Film Screening and Discussion

When: Tuesday May 17,[masked]:00 – 9:00pm (Doors 6:30pm)

Where: Imagenation’s Raw Space 2031 Adam Clayton Powell Blvd. (7th Ave bet 121st and 122nd)

Cost:  Free . Visit www.imagenation.us for details.

On Tuesday May 17, 2016, Reelblack teams with Imagenation for a special night of rare animation and discussion on race.

In 1968, United Artists chose to withhold the distribution rights for 11 Looney Tunes and Merrie Melodies cartoons due to the offensiveness of racial stereotypes presented in them. Since that time, successive rights holders have upheld this ban on broadcast and theatrical screenings, and the short cartoons have only been shown once, in 2010, in a screening held by Warner Bros. However, copies do exist in the hands of collectors and we invite you to a special screening of all 11 of these controversial works!

Join Reelblack TV’s Michael Dennis and Charles Woods for this viewing, followed by a lively conversation on art, culture, race and history! Michael Dennis is a filmmaker and the founder of Reelblack, a full-service film and video production company dedicated to creating and promoting “good movies ’bout Black Folks. Charles Woods is a NYC-based archivist, historian and collector Black film and memorabilia for over  40 years.

results.description:
The NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group Is Accepting New Members

The NYC Atheists’ Advanced Writers Group, now going for two years, is open to talented writers who want the support and camaraderie of other secular writers in polishing their work and getting happily published.  Our group meets once a month; we gently critique each other’s work, but our main focus is on helping each other get published. There is no charge for this workshop; we ask only that you commit to meeting once a month, reading the work of the other members and offering your suggestions for improvement in an upbeat, encouraging manner.

What do we mean by “advanced writers?”

We mean those writers who are close to being published or have already been published in some form. We also mean writers who, we can see by reading samples of their writing, have great potential but until now have not been mentored or encouraged to treat their work seriously or to aim for publication.

How do you know if you fit our criteria for a writer with promise?

You don’t.  Writers are often poor judges of the level of their talent. We suggest that you give us the opportunity to judge that, because we can often sense that spark of talent even if you yourself do not.  Additionally, we have recently instituted a new member category, dubbed “Apprentice author”--individuals who demonstrate potential but who have not yet been published anywhere or achieved commercial capability.

Submit a Sample

If you are interested in joining this kind of a close and involved group of writers, submit a sample of your writing (15 pages or less) to the group,plus a personal letter telling us a little about your background, what you are aiming for and what you think we can do for you. Your sample submission may be a play, fiction or non-fiction. If fiction, it can be a short story or a chapter of a book.  If non-fiction, the sample can be an article or a chapter of a non-fiction book. If a play, send only Act One.

If you are accepted into the group, we ask only that you encourage and support each group member by reading his or her material, critiquing it in a kindly, professional manner and attend our monthly meeting to discuss it in a group setting. There is no charge whatsoever for membership in the Advanced Writers Group.  Our goal is to encourage more good secular writers to enter the literary marketplace.

Bear in mind that once you are accepted, everyone in the group accepts that you are headed for publication; this is not a “learn to write” group. This is a group whose members have shown themselves to have solid skills and need only minimum critiquing or, more importantly, encouragement in tackling the publishing industry, which, when done alone, can be discouraging. We are there as friends, as your cheerleaders, your mentors, your colleagues.

Jane Everhart, Facilitator  NYCA Advanced Writers Group

NYC ATHEISTS CONTACT: [masked]

TO APPLY, PLEASE SEND A SAMPLE OF YOUR WRITING (15 pages or less) plus a brief bio and a letter telling us what you think we can do for you, to:

NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group                                                                                                c/o NYC Atheists Inc.                                                                                                                        Box 6060 NY, NY[masked]

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
We will begin our evening with a few ritual demonstrations for creating sacred space, cleansing, clearing and healing. 

We will use minerals, crystals, elixirs, sound and angel cards to cleanse, align and bring in the highest healing vibrations into our scared space.

A ritual returns you to what matters. The very act of beginning a ritual puts us in a state of mind where we can break with the routine patterns of the mundane and remember the sacred.

What makes a ritual sacred?

A ritual is any action we take that has meaning beyond its appearance. What makes a ritual sacred, however, is the intention behind it. The word “sacred” comes from the Latin word sacrum, which relates to power or strength. So, a sacred ritual is an exchange or action that you imbue with meaning, thus giving it power. Rituals can have a impact on people’s thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.

All are welcome and will have an opportunity to receive Reiki healing.

Come on out to the Tara Hill Irish Tavern for a bluegrass jam.

This jam is for all level of players.  There will be a mix of traditional instruments and any uke players who come from this group.

Bring a song to share.  It's best if you have at least some printouts of the music.  Traditionally at a bluegrass jam people take turns leading the songs.  If you don't have any bluegrass songs other country or folk songs fit too. 

If you don't have a song or don't want to lead, that's ok too. 

In case you were thinking that you don't play much bluegrass, come anyway!  Most bluegrass is pretty easy to play. 

The plan is to do these jams every first and third Tuesday of the month.

Prana is the intelligent life force energy in and around everything. It is the energy that creates galaxies and keeps them spinning. The energy which directs the growth of an embryo and the flourishing of a Forrest. It is the energy that keeps us alive, healthy & vital. When mastered through practices like Tai Chi, Qi Gong, Yoga, and Pranic Breathing, Prana can be cultivated, stored, directed and utilized in daily life. When received through another Pranic Being during deep relaxation it can wash over your entire being like a cleansing rainstorm washing away toxins, accumulations, pains, tensions and limiting patterns creating space for deep healing, nourishing and transformation. Even if it sounds mystical to you, I assure you it is simply the most natural and intelligent process in the world! Let love in

results.description:
You are a multi-dimensional being arising as one occasion... 

(What?)

It means 

• (1) you have an experience interior to you 

• (2) you have an experience exterior to you 

• (3) you experience the world as an individual and 

• (4) you experience a shared world. 

All of this is happening at the same time, in a co-mingled experience.

• Your individual interior is your Mind. 

• Your individual exterior is your Body.

• Your shared interior are your Relationships. 

• Your shared exterior is your Environment.

At the Meetup, we address the Environment -- our mutually shared exteriors -- by discussing what's going on in other areas.  But what's really cool is that since you're arising as one occasion, a supportive Environment supports your Body, Mind, and Relationships.

See you soon!

results.description:
The North Water by Ian McGuire  (272 pages)


In May, we'll be discussing The North Water. 

It's about a thrilling 19th-century Arctic whaling expedition and the lives of two particular men on board. And look at that cover! 

"Mr. McGuire is not reveling in such Sweeney Todd splatter effects simply to be sensational; rather, he puts them in the service of a Hobbesian view of life as nasty, brutish and short, and plagued by fear and violent death."

—The New York Times

We'll be discussing this novel in a pub that is owned by writers. They regularly hold literary and photography events, and I'm excited to check it out with you! 

-----

More details:

- Attendance for this Meetup is capped at 10 members. 

- I’ll be charging an Event Fee for each Meetup to discourage no-shows. If something comes up, kindly RSVP ‘no’ at least 2 days before the scheduled date and you’ll be refunded. Money collected will be donated to the New York Public Library or can even go towards a portion of our tab. 

- Please arrive on time!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor.

I can't even imagine how many models, comedians, musicians and other spectacles have appeared on our stage for you! How many artists came to draw, how many works of art were created! How many cocktails and beers were downed?! That's a cause for celebration, don't you think? You're right, and you should be a part of it!

Martina Fisherova
Katelyn Richards
Mike Ogletree
Comedy from Matt Nagin


And because it's our 50th, we have cupcakes from The Mighty Aphrodite catering!


We're in one of the city's coolest, grooviest TIKI bars offering an amazing constellation of exotic drinks (tiny umbrellas are the least of it!)

It's a party, it's a serious art event, it's a blast! So bring your weirdest friends and your favorite art materials and create some great art! All of this for a mere $20 at the door!

Over21 only (IDs will be checked)

Entry price does not include beverages

The February Dinner & Discussion will start with dinner at the Park West Diner in Little Falls at 6:30 PM. Here's a link to their site: http://www.parkwestdiner.com/. Anyone there by 6:30 will be at our table. Anyone arriving late is on their own. At dinner we talk about everything in the world except the evening's topic.

Part 2:

Discussion at Versailles Diner, 8:00 PM

The Discussion will be held at 8:00 PM at The Versailles Diner on Route 46 West in Fairfield, New Jersey.

The evening's discussion will focus on works of science fiction, fantasy and horror which are set in the sea and at the bottom of the ocean. This includes works like VOYAGE TO THE BOTTOM OF THE SEA and 20,000 LEAGUES UNDER THE SEA.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

Our members are focused on fostering relationships with one another which naturally lead to business referrals over time.

We welcome visitors to come see what we are all about!

Skip the morning run and instead meet us between 6:30 AM and 8:30 AM bi-weekly to chat, code and have the first coffee together to start the day off with developers or other software professionals who care about the quality of the code and passionately looking for ways to improve themselves.

results.description:
A lawyer can play a variety of roles if you are considering buying or selling a small business or starting a new business.  The role of the lawyer is sometimes confined to the technical aspects such as preparing a purchase agreement or reviewing a lease, or just doing an incorporation of a new company. A lawyer however, should be viewed in addition, as the coordinator of a variety of investigations and due diligence processes to ensure that your new business has the best opportunity of succeeding. It is the duty of lawyers to ensure that you understand all the risks you are confronting, which sometimes get overlooked in the enthusiasm to acquire or start the new business.

Stop by and listen to Jerome M Douglas, an attorney for the past 21 years focuses on various areas of law including Commercial and Residential Real Estate Law.  Mr. Douglas has  a proven track record of successful results and has been voted as one of Bergen's top Lawyers for Business.  

Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on May 18th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.
results.name: BNI Crossroads Breakfast & Networking...Come and bring your business cards

results.description:
Conversation starts promptly at 8 am - join early for bagels, coffee, and networking. 

Our first Meetup is all about the buzzword at the moment in the marketing and advertising industry, and that is programmatic. Not only is it a hot topic, it's also often lost-in-translation. Even c-level and senior management admit to not understanding programmatic advertising. Not to mention, everything is changing so quickly - it's hard to keep up. 

That's why I'm excited to announce our first guest speaker Mr. Erik Requidan, from Intermarkets. Erik understands that the media landscape is always evolving, and makes an effort to evolve with it. Advertisers, agencies and publishers need more tools than ever. He helps companies find them, employ and deliver effective results.

As a standout leader in building digital sales, operations, marketing and development teams, Erik strives to be an innovative developer of new communications models that achieve measurable and impactful experiences. 

Key takeaways from this Meetup are: 


- Who are the key players in programmatic
- What are the major roles in the programmatic space (DSP, SSP, etc.)
- How to describe programmatic to a client
- Better yet, how would you describe programmatic to your grandparents
- How to effectively sell the value of programmatic
- Best practices when negotiating a programmatic sale

All of this great content will follow with networking! 

Hope to see you there,
Maddy
results.name: How to sell Programmatic Advertising

results.description:
Hi Community Builders!


[Please RSVP here!]

We're super excited to announce this great event hosted by our friends at LivePerson! 

This panel will look into how we define culture in today’s tech scene and have a real talk about how to cultivate it - authentically -  and what matters most to your most important asset, your employees.

“Company culture” has become a buzzword, prompting companies large and small to show off their hammocks, beer fridges and unlimited vacation policies. However culture is not about the perks, and runs far deeper than being listed on a“Best Place to Work” list. So what are the expectations of today’s tech company in NYC? What do they need to do to attract and retain top talent, and how do they showcase culture in an authentic manner?



SCHEDULE 



8:30 AM
Registration, Breakfast, Networking and Mimosas
Gather at LivePerson's ground-breaking office in Hudson Yards. Mingle with leaders shaping the NYC Tech landscape, including heads of HR and People at leading tech companies, employee engagement innovators, start up entrepreneurs and recruiting gurus. 

9:30 - 10:30
ROI of Company Culture: A Dive into NYC's Tech Scene
Our panel of innovators from Fast Company, Zady.com, WeWork, LivePerson and Live in the Grey (check out our A-lister lineup in the Speaker section below) will share their insights having watched the NY tech scene evolve from Silicon Alley to the world we know today. 

10:30 - 11:30 
Connection 
Reflect on the panel, make new contacts and schedule some lunch plans. 

SPEAKERS NEAL UNGERLEIDER, FAST COMPANY | REPORTER
Neal Ungerleider is a reporter for Fast Company focusing on the intersection of technology and everyday life. His articles have also been published in Wired, Slate, the Los Angeles Times, Forbes, and many other venues. Neal resides in Los Angeles, where he also works as a industry consultant.


KRISTY SUNDJAJA, LIVEPERSON | GLOBAL HEAD OF PEOPLE 
Kristy Sundjaja is the chief of staff and the global head of people at LivePerson, the global leader in intelligent online consumer engagement. In her role, Kristy integrates and aligns business and people strategies to deliver the company mission of creating meaningful connections to consumers and brands. Prior to her role at LivePerson, Kristy was part of the NYC Mayor Michael Bloomberg Administration, where she served as the head of the industry transformation teams department. She has also advised some of the world’s leading media and tech companies, including IBM, Microsoft, HP, and AOL. She holds a BS in economics from the Wharton School of Business, a BS and MS in engineering from the School of Engineering at the University of Pennsylvania, and an Executive MBA degree from Columbia University.

SORAYA DARABI, ZADY.COM | CO-FOUNDER
Soraya Darabi is a trailblazing authority on digital consumerism and how to apply new technologies to foster efficiency, visibility and growth. At The New York Times, Darabi became the newspaper’s first-ever Manager of Digital Partnerships and Social Media at the age of 23, where she formed and implemented the global news leader’s first-ever digital and social media strategies. The New York Times still has these strategies in place today. As a result, she became recognized around the world for her authority as a game changer in a rapidly evolving and hard-to-understand digital world. In fact, Fast Company featured her on the cover of their “Most Creative People in Business” issue. Soon afterward, Darabi co-founded Foodspotting, (which was acquired by Open Table), and most recently Zady.com, one of the first online retailers to seamlessly integrate e-commerce, rich media content and social media to deliver a truly dynamic shopping experience. Zady empowers customers to take a deeper look into how and where their clothes are made—by offering beautifully constructed goods with a low environmental footprint in a world of cheap prices and fast production. 

JOHN REID DODICK, WEWORK | CHIEF PEOPLE  OFFICER
John helps WeWork deliver its mission to create a world where people work to make a life, not just a living. John previously served as chief people officer at Dun & Bradstreet and AOL. An expert in leadership, talent, and organizational culture and change, John has led a number of initiatives that have received industry awards and been featured as best practice in publications such as Stephen Bungay, The Art of Action (2011); Jeff DeGraff and Shawn Quinn, Leading Innovation (2006); and Simon Barrow and Richard Moseley, The Employer Brand (2005). A lawyer by training, John joined Reuters in 1995, serving as general counsel for Reuters America. John graduated from Harvard Law School, where he was Managing Editor of the Harvard Law Review. He holds a Masters degree in Politics from New York University and a Bachelors degree in Political Studies from the University of Manitoba.


BRAD LANDE, LIVE IN THE GREY | CEO</a> 
Brad is CEO of Live in the Grey, which offers workplace experiences and transformational events designed to create authentic workplaces where people feel free to bring their whole selves to work everyday. He brings a passion for entrepreneurial innovation and mission-driven companies, as well as twenty years of experience at high growth startups building world class teams.

Prior to Live in the Grey, Brad was a GM at Birchbox. Brad has also worked as a technology strategy consultant at Accenture, Senior Applications Manager at Yahoo!, partner at Olivia, co-Founder and CEO of mPowered Solutions, and President of Lookbooks Media. Brad currently serves as Board President of BOFFO, a nonprofit that empowers creative leaders to use art and design as a vehicle for change. 

Don't forget, please <a href="https://roiofcompanycultureiwny.splashthat.com/?gz=44bb009ca6c83b0d9a0f4bbf9b4bb311&pp=1">RSVP HERE. 
Thanks to LivePerson for putting this together!

Can't wait! Hope to see you all there!
results.name: ROI of Company Culture: A Dive into NYC's Tech Scene

Please join us for another great NJ IAMCP meeting!   Besides the networking, which will start about 8:30AM, we will also have presentations on: 

• Microsoft SMB Sprint to the Finish offers and incentives in market thru the end of the year to drive sales.

• Concur Expense System

• Skype for Business Presentation for potential prospects

• We will also be talking about the WPC coming up shortly


Making the SMB presentation will be Microsoft's Christine Gannon. She is a Partner Channel Development Manager with Microsoft.  Christine has been with Microsoft for 6 years and previously worked in the Microsoft Partner Channel for 10+ years.

In her current role at Microsoft, Christine is part of the Small and Midsize Business (SMB) group that focuses on customers that have <200 employees.  To reach the hundreds of thousands of SMBs in New York Metro, Christine managed close alliances with Influencer Partners such as the Manhattan Chamber of Commerce, National Association of Women Business Owners, Women’s Leadership Exchange, The National Speaker’s Association, and several others in the Tri-State area.

Christine is passionate in her involvement with the Influencers she works with and reaching SMBs with a technology message.  Christine is driven by her CEO, Satya Nadella’s message to “reinvent productivity to empower every person and every organization on the planet to do more and achieve more” and to win the hearts and minds of the SMB customer.

To be considered for an invite to this event, please fill in the following form: http://bit.ly/io2016-ext-googlenyc

-- 

This event is full. Try RSVP-ing for GDG New York event on May 26 instead  http://www.meetup.com/gdgnyc/events/230494841/

---

I/O is Google's signature developer conference happening in Mountain View CA from May 18 -May 20. For those who cannot attend that event in person, there are a number of I/O Extended events being run worldwide by GDG communities and by Google offices. The I/O Keynote will be live-streamed at these events and you will also have an opportunity to listen to tech talks from local experts and network with your local community.


Google NYC is hosting an I/O Extended event in their office on May 18 that is invite-only. As their community partner, GDG New York has been given a limited number of invites to provide to our members

To be considered for an invite to this event, please fill in the following form: http://bit.ly/io2016-ext-googlenyc We will review applications and send out confirmations to the selected few by the end of the week.


NOTE:
1. This application is for an invite to an I/O Extended event in NYC (and not to the Google I/O event in CA) 

2. The event will run for almost the whole day so please be sure you can commit to attending before you apply. Once you are selected, we cannot transfer the ticket. As a result, we want to make sure we prioritize those who are guaranteed to attend.

3. In our commitment to inclusion, we will be reserving some of these invites for members of under-represented groups.

Her Zimbabwe An online startup gathering news, critique and analysis from young Zimbabwean women.

Volt Data Volt is the first data-driven news agency in Brazil, reporting on human rights, social development, economic issues and technology

results.description:
Are you considering working with a financial advisor, but aren't sure who you can trust?  Or how they can even help you?  

Having a family can add complexity to your financial situation at a point when you have the least time to deal with it - but trusting your money to someone else can be daunting, to say the least.  Join us for a candid conversation about the benefits that a financial advisor can provide and how you can find a trustworthy advisor who is right for your family.

We'll be talking about:

• The benefits of managing your money yourself versus hiring an advisor

• How to spot red flags for scam artists and conmen

• The different ways advisors can be compensated - and how it can affect the advice they give you

• Tips for finding an advisor who is right for you

We hope you'll join us for this informative webinar!

Is your content marketing working?

We’ve all heard "content is king” and is extremely important for business growth. Traditional selling is out and inbound marketing is in. There has also been recent backlash against content marketing as some argue it doesn’t work. When you see this statistic, it’s not shocking:

“More content is being created in 48 hours than what was produced from the beginning of time until 2003.” – Eric Schmidt

Register here

In this webinar we’ll build on the discussion from our last Meetup and discuss why content marketing is still relevant and how to make sure you’re getting a solid ROI on your efforts.

Pitfalls: Common Mistakes

Success: How to Get Results

Metrics: How to Measure and Improve

Discover the Secret of High Performing Software Teams


By Addteq

Addteq is an Atlassian Platinum Expert, this means we’ve mastered our skills with Atlassian's products and we’re looking to share our knowledge with you! Addteq is hosting an Atlassian Dev Tools Event - this is devoted to customers and prospective clients who are interested in learning how to take their development team to the next level. Join us for live sessions including innovative demos, great guest speakers, partner integrations and so much more. 

Agenda:

9:00 am - 2:30pm -    Classroom Style JIRA Admin Training

2:30pm - 3:10pm   -   Registration Begins for High Performing Software Teams

3:10pm - 3:30pm   -   Welcoming Keynote with Addteq's Founder, Sukhbir Dhillon

3:30pm - 4:10pm -     Tools for High Performing Software Teams, with Atlassian's Kelvin Yap

4:10pm - 4:40pm -     Improved Collaboration and Delivery with Puppet and Atlassian with Puppet's James Sweeney

                                 -- 15 minute BREAK --

4:55pm - 5:25pm   -   Securing the Software Supply Chain – how Sonatype and Atlassian Work Together with Sonatype's Curtis Yanko

5:25pm - 5:55pm   -   Building a Software Delivery Automation Framework by Integrating Atlassian DevTools, Artifactory & Sonarqube - MetLife Success Story

5:55pm - 6:25pm   -   Continuous Everything with Addteq's CTO, Himanshu Chhetri

6:30pm - 9:00pm   -    Mingling, Light Eats & 10 Year Anniversary Celebration

Who Should Attend?

If you are interested in DevOps and CI/CD, then you should attend!

This event is free of charge and our main goal is to demonstrate the use of Atlassian tools in every setting. Interested managers, developers, advanced and new Atlassian users, decision makers, stakeholders are all invited to join. Teams that should attend include Application Development/Delivery, Engineering, Product Management, QA and IT.

Space is limited, so please RSVP HERE soon!

FOR THOSE INTERESTED IN JIRA ADMIN TRAINING,  please visit THIS LINK for more details. 

Make sure to plan to stay for Addteq's 10 Year Celebration!

To celebrate 10 successful years providing professional services to more than 300 customers, Addteq is hosting an evening with dinner, drinks and festivities. We welcome all attendees for the Atlassian Dev Tools Event to stay and join the party and welcome guests who are only able to join the evening celebration.
