Join Robert Caplin and Andrew Renneisen for a live podcast recording at Adorama's Event Space in NYC! PhotoBrigade.com/LIVE


Andrew Renneisen is an American freelance documentary photographer based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania interested in documenting conflict, race, and ethnic and social issues domestically and internationally. He is represented by Getty Images Reportage and is a frequent contributor to The New York Times. Prior to Philadelphia, Andrew attended the S.I. Newhouse School of Public Communications at Syracuse University with focuses in photography and information management and technology. Andrew has interned at The New York Times, The Philadelphia Inquirer, The Press of Atlantic City, and The Wilmington News Journal. Andrew has contributed to clients and publications such as The New York Times, National Geographic, The Washington Post, Time, Rolling Stone, Bloomberg Businessweek, Stern, Mother Jones, NBC News, and Getty Images amongst others. He has been honored with awards from American Photography, The Hearst Foundation, College Photographer of the Year, and The Alexia Foundation.

This is a 8 mile, one-way paddle. I will have a car already spotted at the North end so no need to worry about that!

The Wallkill river is calm, gentle flowing river.

**The Wallkill River shares with great rivers like the Nile and the Rhine the unique distinction of northward flow. This quiet river eventually feeds into the Hudson River

8 miles on meandering Wallkill River through historic towns. Flat water, slow current, little tree coverage. Conclude with pastries on Perrine’s Bridge

Who's Organizing?
Chris Baker[masked]

---------------------------------------------------------

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Yoga Group Lessons geared to introduce basic yoga principles of Asana practice, Pranayama, and Vipassana meditation.

The ultimate purpose of this yoga class is to prepare practitioners to develop a discipline and daily yoga practice in order to exercise introspection, build self awareness and ultimately achieve growth.

Yoga Dance Theater: Cultivating Patience,  Perseverance, Endurance, Discipline, Humility, Solitude, Altruism, Devotion, Reflection, Self-Restrain, Renunciation, Transparency, Non-attachment, and Spiritual Illumination.
results.how_to_find_us: MTA - E train to 53rd and Lexington, walk South to 49th. Or take Crosstown Bus # 50.  Walk one block South to 49th st.  .
results.name: Yoga Group Lesson - Beginning to up to two years background experience Fri May 6

results.description:
Since Wendesdays in the Spring and Summer tend to be the most popular times. I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 24 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP"yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" and arrive before or at 5:30 and slots are open, you are given a spot. For those who do not RSVP and just show up must wait until 5:30pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 13 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  for those who show up late, I will set some cones aside so you can play a smaller game against anyone else who shows up late. If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14, the field does not have enough space.

 If you have any gripes about this please message me and we can talk but in all likely-hood I will not make an exception.
results.name: Soccer meetup

results.description:
Join us for 2-hour Shamanic Breathwork workshop every Wednesday, 5:45pm-7:45pm, starting Wed, January 27, 2016  In this Shamanic Breathwork™ workshop you will experience healing that draws on the wisdom of Shamanic practices and contemporary psycho-spiritual models.   This experience will allow you to  connect with the shaman within and access the power of healing and transformation using  breath and music. People who experience  Shamanic Breathwork report an increase in physical and emotional well-being.  We will be using the breath and chackra attunes music to go through a powerful shamanic journey, heal and release energies that no longer serve you and open to a deeper connection with spirit guides, your inner-guidance and power.  

Fee for one session:  $35

Special offer:  Register for 3 sessions and get the 4th free.  (a saving of $35)

To register call the NY Open Center at[masked]-2527.

If you choose to drop in, please arrive early to register at the front desk.  

If you have any question, don't hesitate to call me at[masked] or write me at [masked]. for more information at  http://www.opencenter.org/events/shamanic-breathwork-drop-in-classes-2/

or http://www.simpletruthwithin.com/upcoming-events/ 

Looking forward to seeing you and have you part of our community.

Smadar

results.description:
If you're interested in being critiqued, please send your first 20 pages, double spaced, to [masked] by 5/9. This could be any combination of the following: prose, outline (to critique the plot), or synopsis/query letter (to critique in advance of querying agents). The first two submissions sent will be discussed.

If you would like to, please also mention in the body of the document what you would like readers to focus on, whether it's the positives to encourage you to keep writing, the plot, the world-building, etc.

Those who have RSVP'd will get links for download by 5/10. Looking forward to seeing you all there! Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
results.name: YA Critique Session

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at  [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will ever experience! Forget about crowded clubs, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to NEW Madison Square Tavern in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  We will have the entire balcony area for our group. (it holds over 100)

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

Drink specials till 7pm

$5 Bud Light Drafts

$6 Craft Beers

$8 Wine

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-Fun and friendly bar staff

-A full menu available 

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Any train to Penn Station Herald Square

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: NYC's Friendliest After Work Party at The New Madison Square Tavern

results.description:
The Business English for Career Series includes business theory and business vocabulary: formal business English and informal business idioms and expressions, and business conversations.

This event topic is specific to finance (i.e. financial institutions, financial services, investments, careers in finance, etc.)

Topic: Investing 101

- Introduction to Investing,

- Types of investments (i.e. equities, bonds, futures, alternative investments, etc.), and

- Portfolio Diversification

This will be from a perspective of corporate and personal finance.

Event is Free! Material is $10 (includes handouts and online material)

RSVP: Seating is on a first come, first served basis whether you have RSVPed or not, so we suggest arriving early.
results.name: Business English Career Series: Finance

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will ever experience! Forget about crowded clubs, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to NEW Madison Square Tavern in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  We will have the entire balcony area for our group. (it holds over 100)

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

Drink specials till 7pm

$5 Bud Light Drafts

$6 Craft Beers

$8 Wine

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Our next meeting will be generously hosted by James (Jim) Shenwick at his office (location visible above to group members) on Wednesday, May 18, 6 - 7 p.m.

In addition to our usual quality networking and pop-up law firm-style idea bouncing, we're premiering a new theme that we'll bring back every few months: the Practice Feature.


This month, we'll focus on Jim's bankruptcy practice and he will fill us in on The Nuts and Bolts of Personal Bankruptcy in 2016: what we need to know to counsel clients, friends or family members (with an emphasis on remedies available to debtors under New York State and Federal Bankruptcy law). Jim will provide written materials for all attendees. This is a meeting you do not want to miss!

Space is limited, so please RSVP by Wednesday, May 11, and as always feel free to invite any of your solo colleagues who you think would benefit from this month's discussion.

Also, please save the date for our June 15th meeting, which will feature a presentation on how to protect ourselves from cybersecurity threats facing small law firms.
results.name: May meeting - Nuts and Bolts of Personal Bankruptcy in 2016

Inline skate lesson for Beginner to intermediate skaters. 


Cost of this class is: $25 per individual class, $45 for 2 classes or $60 for package of 3 classes; discount packages should be paid in full; fees are collected before class begins, however we suggest that you to pay in advance, using Pay Pal option. 

Please note that you must have complete set of protection gear and helmet to participate in class. 

Central Park Sightseeing is now renting skates! 
The website does not make it clear that they rent skates….but they do!  $25 for 24 hours. www.centralparksightseeing.com 
Please rent from them, if you need to and be sure to have them mention that Central Park Skate Patrol sent you there. 

We meet Just inside the West 72nd Street Entrance to Central Park at 6:00PM, The class leaves for the lesson area by 6:15PM.  We will then walk to the practice area so we are geared up ready to skate by 6:30PM.

Reminder – wrist guards, helmets, knee and elbow pads are required to participate in class. These items have to be purchased in advance. Please check all of your gear before coming to class to see if it fits properly. Make sure the wheels, buckles, straps, snaps, laces and everything else is in good working order.

Please note that if it is raining or the lesson surface is wet, we will NOT have the class. Cancelation of class will be posted in advance. 
If you have any other questions, please post them on this page or text/call me at [masked]

EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION:


With a growing number of Korean-Americans and Korean internationals working and studying in the city, they wanted to create a place where these busy dwellers of New York can find the perfect home-cooked meal, prepared with the goal of bringing about the flavors of their mothers’ cooking.

So they created a place that is more than a restaurant, a home away from home where we remove the commercial components that have become the standard in the food service industry, and use only traditional Korean ingredients and recipes to produce what they like to call “Korean soul food.”

their mission was not to replicate the fancy contemporary culinary experience, but to design a nostalgic one, where guests can enjoy an authentic Korean meal, all with the same feeling of comfort as eating at home.

IN HONOR OF THE TESLA SCIENCE FOUNDATION AND  THE PRESTIGIOUS AWARD  OF "RECOGNITION " GIVEN TO ANDREA ROSE THIS WORKSHOP IS COMPLIMENTARY .  WE INVITE  ALL ATTENDEES  TO BE OUR GUEST!!  FOR ALL INVENTORS WITH THAT GREAT "IDEA"YOUR INVITED TO "PITCH A PRODUCT™" NIGHT at MICROSOFT. 

ANDREA ROSE® & HER MARKETING ASSOCIATES ARE LOOKING FOR THAT NEXT "WINNING" PRODUCT TO BRING TO MARKET! WE  ARE EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE WE HAVE ALSO TEAMED UP WITH HSN! 

THE INVENTORS ROAD SHOW IS HONORED  TO HAVE TEAMED UP WITH THE TESLA SCIENCE FOUNDATION! The Tesla Science Foundation's mission is to establish and promote the recognition and awareness of Nikola Tesla's inventions, patents, theories, philosophies, lectures, and innovations. With the Foundations 11,000+ strong  followers & inventors.   The Inventors Road Show™ will help bring their inventor's new "Ideas to Industry™.


ANDREA ROSE RECEIVING AWARD FROM THE TESLA SCIENCE FOUNDATION PRESIDENT NIKOLA LONCHAR DURING THE LAUNCH OF THE INVENTORS ROAD SHOW IN PHILADELPHIA

LEARN HOW TO "PITCH A PRODUCT" & GET YOUR "IDEA TO INDUSTRY"!!

We are excited to announce at ‘The Inventors Road Show™” our  workshop “Pitch a Product™”.   Award winning inventor Andrea Rose® will facilitate the evening helping the group  learn how to present their products to market while on the lookout for that next “Winning” product to introduce to her marketing associates that include such companies as"As Seen On TV, mass retailers, international distributors , catalog and television home shopping companies to name a few. We are excited to announce we have teamed up with HSN!!

Attendees will have “5 minutes” to pitch their inventions to the group.  This workshop helps inventors learn how to present their “Ideas to Industry™”.  It also helps them discover how to look at their inventions as a solution to a problem that is needed in the marketplace.  To have a successful  “product/invention”  it must fill a need in the marketplace and this workshop explores this very important aspect of inventing.  During each workshop we discuss  other various topics that provide the attendees with the tools they will need  to turn their "Idea" into a commercial success.  All inventors are welcome!!!

NOTE:  Andrea Rose® is an award winning inventor who has alliances with companies that provide services to inventors.  We at "The Inventors Road Show™" are excited to announce we have teamed up with HSN!!!  Andrea will be providing the group with her expert advice and looking for the next  "Winning" invention to present to her marketing partners.

Andrea does one on one consulting for inventors who are seeking personalize assistance. For more information contact:  [masked]

(From time to time there will be surprise guests who will join Andrea Rose® at the workshops.)

        We are honored to have joined with The Tesla Science Foundation


DISCLAIMER:  Andrea Rose® is not an attorney and does not provide any legal advice to any inventor. All inventors  pitching and presenting their inventions in the workshop should have filed for a provisional patent, have a patent-pending or an issued patent if they choose to participate in giving a pitch to the group.  Otherwise their idea could loose the legal  protection that is provided by filing for a patent.  It will be at the discretion of the inventor if they want to pitch their product.

For more information email us at: [masked]

WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK OUR SPONSORS & CONTRIBUTORS FOR THIS EVENT: 

 Jason  B. Scher, Attorney at Carter, Deluca, Farrell & Schmidt, LLP                                                                                                                                                                             Microsoft 

 NV STUDIOS

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Kickball for Grownups (Co-ed)

What role has Luck played in your life, 
for good or ill? 
Can we make our own Luck – 
individually, and together? 
Does belief in Luck help us cope – 
or is it pernicious? 
Does Luck make life inherently unfair? 
(Think genes, trust funds, where you were born…)

6:15 sharp - 8:00 pm (please arrive by 6:00) Followed at 8:15-9:00 
by Conversations New York (CNY) Activists’ Conclave

Suggested optional reading: 
SUCCESS AND LUCK: Good Fortune and the Myth of Meritocracy 
(Princeton University Press, 2016), 
By Robert H. Frank, Prof. of Management and Economics, Cornell University.

To reserve a place, please register both by RSVP to 
[masked], and to http://www.meetup.com/Conversations-New-York/

Subways: #1 to Canal (building is on same block); A, C. or E to Canal; J, N, Q, R, W, Z or #6 to Canal. All these Canal Street stations are within walking distance of the building. Bus: M20 stops at the front door. Government-issued ID required for entry to building, please.

Excellent take-out can be purchased at THE MILL, <a>www.THEMILLTOGO.COM,</a> located next to the building, and brought to the meeting.


Conversations New York 

(www.conversationsnewyork.com) is a community of volunteers which has promoted more and better conversations among New Yorkers by such activities as an annual Conversation Day in Bryant Park, an on-line calendar featuring 1,000 conversations a year, and the first national symposium on The Power of Conversation held at Columbia University.

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]

results.description:
Players of all skill levels are welcome. Westchester FC is about playing the beautiful game in a fun environment where everyone can get a good workout and improve their skills. It doesn't matter if you are the Messi of White Plains or you have never kicked a ball before, all you need are shoes.

While we will spend most of the time playing pick-up games, we will start with some warm-up to get the blood flowing. SPREAD THE WORD and get your friends to sign up!

I can't stress enough that fun is the top priority, because of this, no rough play (slide tackling is prohibited) or rude language. Violators will be warned, sent off, suspended or banned from Westchester FC games. We want everyone to feel comfortable so that we can really grow this club.

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Cubicon Single

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance

• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.

results.description:
Dear WomenAndMoney Members,

Please join us, for free, for an introduction to Risk-Managed, Tax-Efficient Investing on Wednesday, May 18.

We will survey goals/objectives, risk tolerance, time horizons, the basics of investing (e.g. products, liquidity, costs), risk-management,  asset allocation, after-tax returns, administration, and how to develop a portfolio.

We will network before the formal part of the program.  We will enjoy refreshments.

Please be prompt as we have a lot to cover.

Bring a friend, a smile, business cards, a pad, and be prepared to leave your fears behind!

Attendance is limited.  Registration ends Tuesday, 5/17, Noon.

RSVP now!
results.how_to_find_us: Main Conference Room by Reception
results.name: Intro to Risk-Managed, Tax-Efficient Investing

results.description:
Join us for a free screening of the film Cowspiracy.

From the Cowspiracy website:


"Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret is a groundbreaking feature-length environmental documentary following intrepid filmmaker Kip Andersen as he uncovers the most destructive industry facing the planet today – and investigates why the world’s leading environmental organizations are too afraid to talk about it.

"As eye-opening as Blackfish and as inspiring as An Inconvenient Truth, this shocking yet humorous documentary reveals the absolutely devastating environmental impact large-scale factory farming has on our planet, and offers a path to global sustainability for a growing population."

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nV04zyfLyN4

This film is so important that Leonardo Dicaprio, a notable environmentalist, came on as Executive Producer and helped bring the film to Netflix:

http://www.onegreenplanet.org/news/leonardo-dicaprio-to-executive-produce-cowspiracy-on-netflix/

This film helped me realize that what we choose to eat is not just a "personal choice," that in fact our food choices have far-reaching environmental consequences beyond ourselves and our own backyards. This has helped inspire me as an activist to do more.

We will have a few vegan snacks for munching while watching. And afterwards, we'll head over to a nearby establishment to grab a bite and chat about the film.

Please be prompt, as the library closes at 8pm so we will be starting the film just a few minutes after 6pm. AND it would be super if you would BRING A NON-VEG FRIEND!


If you are planning on attending our screening, please also RSVP using the library's link so they can keep track of attendees as well.  Thanks!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/earth-day-documentary-and-discussion-tickets-25005044762
results.name: Cowspiracy Screening at the Hoboken Public Library

results.description:
After a strong showing + solid gathering in April, we are pumped to get together at the Digital Arts Experience on May 18. Check out the full details below, including live music and special sessions throughout the night.

B R E A K D O W N  //

6:00-6:45 PM Networking Session

Local musician Emily Angell will be performing during the networking session. Emily fuses raw lyrics and powerful vocals in her acoustic guitar-driven sophomore EP, Let Go. This summer, she'll embark on a US​ national​ tour with emerging country star Jessica Lynn.​ Visit emilyangellmusic.comand follow Emily on Instagram @emangellmusic.​

We are working on finalizing details with a local restaurant + brewery.

6:45-7:00 PM Welcome + Special Demo

A student from the DAE will demo their work with programming.

7:00-8:15 PM Demos + Spotlights

RateFrame - Seth Squadron, Co-Founder + CEO


You know that Taylor Swift video where she falls on the treadmill? Ever want a quick video tutorial on how to brew coffee with an aeropress? RateFrame enables you to highlight your favorite moments on YouTube and share with friends. Bring your laptops to signup during this demo - you are going to want to try this out and tell your family and friends! In the meantime, watch this video designed by the RateFrame team and learn more at rateframe.com.

WeShelter - Brad Sealfon, Partnerships

Approximately 60,000+ homeless people are in NYC shelters each night. WeShelter's mission is to use mobile technology to allow everyone to contribute to ending homelessness. Brad will demo how you can help someone in need by donating or contacting an aid organization in real-time to respond with services. Check out how WeShelter works on their site and make sure you read articles published in The Atlantic + FastCompany. 

Food Bank for Westchester - Ayesha Khan, Director of Fund Development

FBW used advanced technology to provide further insight on where Food Insecurity rates were most prominent in Westchester, and leveraged data analysis methods to identify best practices on how to serve clients and partners in the region. Ayesha will share their story.

8:15-8:30 PM Wrap-up + Announcements

Everyone is encouraged to announce a business and/or community need - looking for a job, searching for a co-founder, need to hire someone, want to share an event... 

S P E C I A L   S E S S I O N S  //

DAE + WTM are partnering to offer members two special working groups on May 18. Email Dan with interest at depotocki[at]gmail[dot]com. 

6:00-7:30 PM Python Session (20 students max)

Members with a child/children between ages 9-15 are encouraged to bring them along to be a part of a programming educational session. At 7:30 PM, the students can join us for the final demo. Small cost: $5 per student

6:00-8:00 PM Hack Session (10 members would be great)

Members who want to brainstorm and hack a solution(s) will have a room reserved during the networking and demo sessions. One idea is for you to join the group at 8:00 PM and share a summary of your hack. No extra cost. 

S P O N S O R S  //

We are excited to have Evolving Media Network sponsor the May WTM!! Check out their website www.evolvingmedia.net


Evolving Media Network is a creative development studio that creates bespoke solutions for your digital needs. EMN's experienced and passionate team of designers, developers, producers, and strategists partners closely with clients to build custom products that meet their needs in innovative, intuitive, and elegant ways.

Contact Kale at kale[at]evolvingmedia[dot]net to share your story and explore a project.

Justworks is changing how businesses handle HR, by streamlining payroll, compliance and healthcare on an intuitive platform. Seriously, their customers love them, and the solution is perfect for startups and growing teams. In the last year, Justworks has partnered with major players across the startup landscape, including Techstars, Grand Central Tech, Work-Bench, Grind + AlleyNYC.

Would you like to learn how Justworks can help your business? Visit Justworks to learn more and contact our good friend Dwight at[masked] and [masked] to inquire.


Quinn for the Win is on a mission to find a cure to ALS. Founded by Pat Quinn after being diagnosed in 2013, Q4TW started the Ice Bucket Challenge which created global awareness and helped raise over $2MM worldwide to support research.


Pat and his wife, Jenn, will provide May WTM attendees with a Q4TW wristband. Learn more about Pat and his journey.

__________

Please note that cost is $15 if paid at door on May 18.

Sign-up today and spread the word. Looking forward to seeing you on May 18. Never hesitate to reach out with any ideas and/or questions.

Cheers, Dan + Ilana

results.description:
Please check meetup site for any cancellations or changes due to weather.

---- FAQ ---- 


What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
results.name: Wednesday Evening Tennis @ Crotona Park

results.description:
Open Play for Advanced Beginners and Intermediate Players.

Our game starts promptly at 6:00pm.  You are welcome to come slightly earlier to change and warm up.

We can accommodate 3 teams, 7 players per team max (single rotation). Rally scoring. Game to 15 cap 17. 

IMPORTANT - Skill Level Required for our Open Play

Know how to rotate on the court, serve, pass, set, spike and block. Know how to hold your position on the court during defense and offense.  This is meant for players that have experience playing.

Rules will be enforced to protect all players from safety and fun.

Recreational players and beginners can practice on the side or come watch for FREE. We also run a skills clinic to improve your game. Please ask!

If you will be attending for the first time, please check in with me for a quick 3 min assessment. 

Thanks and hope to see you on the court!

May
results.name: Volleyball Open Play

results.description:
This free workshop teaches how to use the compass in interaction with a map. If you are hiking on marked trails or bushwhacking to areas not far from trails, a good topographic map may be the only tool you need to plan and maintain your route. If you are planning to be in the wilderness for an extended period of time, you will most likely be using a compass to help you find your way.

COMPASS AND PENCIL REQUIRED. PLEASE DO NOT USE A SMART PHONE APPLICATION.

If you do not have a compass, compasses are available for loan or purchase at Tent & Trails

Instructor: Hank Osborn - East Hudson Program Coordinator for the NY-NJ Trail Conference.

Seats are limited

Contact Jamie Lipman Abish @ email - [masked]

You must register with Tents and Trails by emailing Jamie so please do so right after you RSVP to claim your spot as they are limited.

Hey all! Thanks for your interest in joining us for this evening - unfortunately we had more people tell us that they could not come than those that could. We are in the process of rescheduling and we'll follow up with a new date. Thanks for your continued support of T+L, and we'll see you at our next event in NJ --> http://www.edisonchamber.com/NetSucks


Join us on May 18th at 6:30 pm for “ASK AN ENTREPRENEUR NITE, PART 2” at the Northeast Planning Corp office in Cranford, NJ, presented by Teach + Learn Networking.

Thinking about starting a business or within the first two years of your entrepreneurial journey? We know you’ve got questions. Get them answered and network with other new business owners at this special event.

Last time we did this event, we had a packed house! Arrive early and get ready to connect with and learn from lots of great people.

GET YOUR TICKETS HERE

Our panel of seasoned entrepreneurs will share wisdom and advice on everything from

• Legally forming a business

• Tax considerations and finding start-up funds

• Marketing your ideas

• Creating business plans

• Dealing with triumph and failure as you scale

• …and anything else you’d like to know about running a successful business or self-employment career

About the panel:

Jacob George, Investment Banking and Mergers and Acquisitions with Middle Market Technology Focused Investment Bank

John Leatherdale, Director at Prudential Bank

More panelists to be announced soon!

About the panel moderators:

Cliff Barany - Cliff  was a panelist at our first Ask an Entrepreneur Nite and he now returns as a moderator. He wears many hats – he’s the COO and co-founder of Meridian Physician Solutions, the Business Development Director at Legacy Athletic Club, the owner of Greater Metro Area Volleyball Club, and a Financial Strategist with Northeast Planning Corp. In the course of his work, he travels around the country leading courses on finance and consulting with new business owners.

Sam Popp - Sam is the founder of Teach + Learn Networking, a community of business owners and professionals that believe in success through connection. She’s a frequent speaker on networking and partners with businesses to help them plan events that promote their brand.

What should I bring?

Biz cards, a notebook, and an open mind

How much does it cost?

$5 online
$10 at the door
GET YOUR TICKETS HERE

OUR SPONSORS


Northeast Planning Corporation for providing the space for this event

Teach + Learn Networking for event coordination and support

WANT A BE A SPONSOR OR DO A GIVEAWAY AT THIS EVENT? 
We’d love to share your mission with our members. Email Sam at [masked] for more information.

results.description:
Excerpt taken from the "The Single One In The Group Blog" here.


Honestly, it’s about time that we’ve done a “book club”  type of set up here at The Single One In The Group. And it makes perfect sense that I would choose such a striking title for our first book to discuss.

Of course this is mostly for the ladies out there, but as an equal opportunity “hash it out-er” I’d still love for a few fellas to come out and join us.

The book that we will be reading is by G. L. Lambert and is titled Men Don’t Love Women Like You:  The Brutal Truth About Dating, Relationships, and How To Go From Placeholder to Gamechanger.

Bold right?

Soooooo, it was perfectly fitting for me to encourage ya’ll to get this book so that we could all read it and then sit down together and try to figure this sh*t out collectively.

Cuz honestly, the “tolerating f*ckboy sh*t” is played out like a d*mn 8 track and if ya’ll are anything on my mental wavelength right now you’re just not here for it anymore.

So go and buy the book and let’s meet up and break it down. (Buy it here). I am scheduling the 1st meeting a little over 2 weeks away to give you time to order it and read the 1st 7 chapters.

The book is broken into 3 main subcategories: Awaken the Spartan Within, Date Like a Spartan, and Risk the D*ck. So if you’re in NYC here is the scheduling for the 3 Book Club Meetups related to this book.

Meeting 1:

Wednesday May 11, 2016 at 6:30 pm

Tentative Location – Epistrophy 200 Mott St.

Discussing Chapters 1 – 7:

Ch. 1 – Typical B*tch, Typical Results

Ch. 2 – He Loves You But He’s Not In Love With You

Ch. 3 – D*ck Lies: Using A Man’s Mind Against Him

Ch. 4 – Awaken The Spartan Within

Ch. 5 – The Spartan Secret

Ch. 6 – How To Become A Game Changer

Ch. 7 – How To Attract Men Without Even Trying

Meeting 2:

Wednesday May 18, 2016 at 6:30 pm

Tentative Location: TBA

Discussing Chapters  8 – 21:

Ch. 8 – The 5 Reasons You Failed At Dating

Ch. 9 – Pre-Date Battle Plan

Ch. 10 – Date Night Domination

Ch. 11 – Mastering the First Date

Ch. 12 – How To Ask The Right Questions

Ch. 13 – Post Date Do’s

Ch. 14 – Post Date Don’ts

Ch. 15 – Is His D*ck Spartan Proof?

Ch. 16 – Slaying the Second Date

Ch. 17 – Second Date Checklist

Ch. 18 – Add Him To The Roster or Release Him

Ch. 19 – When To Have Sex

Ch. 20 – How To Transition From Dating To A Relationship

Ch. 21 – The Thing Every Woman Must Do Before Agreeing To A Relationship

Meeting 3:

Wednesday May 25, 2016 at 6:30 pm

Tentative Location: TBA

Discussing Chapters – 22 – 27:

Ch. 22 – Do You Know How To Be A Girlfriend?

Ch. 23 – First Cracks: Conquering Early Relationship Problems

Ch. 24 – Emotional Support: Helping A Man Without Emasculating Him

Ch. 25 – He’s Not A Victim: How To Stop Boyfriend Manipulation

Ch. 26 – Growing Apart: Threesomes, Breaks, & Other Mistakes

Ch. 27 – How To Stop A Breakup

For those of you who are not in NYC you can still join us in dissecting this book, as I will be creating a place for us to discuss it on our Facebook page. So head on over to Amazon and buy it as soon as possible… I have a feeling that it’s going to be a good read. Especially for those of us who have graduated from dating like weak women and want to date like what the author calls “A Spartan!”.

See you on May 11, 18, and 25th!
results.name: 2nd Book Club Meetup To Discuss “Men Don’t Love Women Like You” by G. L. Lambert

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

https://vimeo.com/82163219

https://vimeo.com/87729077

https://vimeo.com/77569204

https://vimeo.com/89375819

Cost:

Your first sample meetup is $15 prepaid only: (choose 'new student' to get a discount) https://getdance.ticketleap.com/semi-private-dance-class/dates

Regular single meetup is $20 or you can get a package of 6 classes for $90 (each class comes up to $15)*

*new students only, available at link above

Cancellation policy: If you need to cancel please do so before 12pm on Tuesday to avoid being charged in full. No shows will be charged in full. Please plan accordingly


Please note that there is at least 4 guys/girls every meetup even though they don't RSVP here, this is a multi-meetup event - join us!

Rewards Cards available - get your card and start earning free classes!

See you on the dance floor! :-)

Monika

results.description:
Luke Wagner

-on-

WebAssembly: A New Compiler Target For The Web

Note: WE ARE MEETING AT CIVIC HALL!! We'll need names, and you will need IDs. RSVP will open Wednesday May 4th, 2016, 4:30pm.


WebAssembly is an emerging standard which defines a compact, efficient, safe, and portable compiler target for the Web.  Driven by active cross-browser collaboration, WebAssembly is rapidly taking shape and should be coming in the future to a browser near you.  This talk will begin by introducing WebAssembly: what it is, what problems it is designed to solve, how it evolved from previous work on asm.js, and the many ways it can (and is, via asm.js) integrate into existing Web applications.  Next, we'll take an in-depth tour of WebAssembly: how to compile it, what it looks like, how it works, how the engine compiles it into efficient machine code, and how it interfaces with JavaScript.  Finally, we'll explore future plans for WebAssembly after its initial release: tighter Web platform integration, supporting languages beyond the low-level memory model of C/C++/Rust, and improved developer tooling.  If you care about alternative programming languages, compiling to the Web, performance, or you like using powerful JS libraries and frameworks, come learn about WebAssembly.


Links:  
https://webassembly.github.io/


Afterwards:
Join us afterwards at Jake's Saloon where we'll continue the discussion over drinks and/or food. Jake's Saloon is located at 206 W. 23rd Street.

Speaker Bio:
Luke Wagner is a Research Engineer at Mozilla and co-chairs the W3C WebAssembly Community Group.  Before WebAssembly, Luke was one of the inventors of asm.js and implemented the initial asm.js optimizations in Firefox.
results.how_to_find_us: Use the far elevator bank to get to the 2nd floor.
results.name: WebAssembly: A New Compiler Target For The Web

results.description:
Come meet adaptive web content expert Karen McGrane, and learn about Postlight's latest product, Mercury.

About Karen

Karen McGrane is a Managing Partner at the user experience consultancy Bond Art + Science. She is a pioneering content strategist who has helped some of the world's largest organizations create user-first publishing platforms.

Karen's work has been seen by hundreds of millions of people. She's also a noted teacher and lecturer who has introduced sound, sane design principles to many thousands of people around the world.


Karen earned her credentials through long experience, helping dozens of traditional publishers—The New York Times, Condé Nast, Hearst, The Atlantic, and Time Inc., among many others—adapt their content for web and mobile. Since founding Bond in 2006, she has led content strategy and information architecture engagements for large institutions in healthcare, financial services, and technology.


She’s also a noted podcast host, the author of Content Strategy for Mobile and Going Responsive, and a long-time friend of Postlight. There’s no one with more expertise on the state of mobile content today.

About Mercury

And we’ll be introducing Postlight’s latest product, Mercury: we’re going to make publishing on the mobile web a whole lot easier.
results.name: Come meet Karen McGrane and see Postlight's new tool for publishers

results.description:
Hi Nodesters! We've got some great talks this month!

* NOTE THE NEW LOCATION at EBAY!!!*

Guy Podjarny - Stranger danger: Addressing the security risk in npm dependencies

Open source modules, and especially npm, are undoubtedly awesome. However, they also represent an undeniable and massive risk. You’re introducing someone else’s code into your system, often with little or no scrutiny. Each component may have vulnerabilities (~14% of them do), be compromised, or even be outright malicious. Multiply that risk by hundreds of dependencies, and you have a recipe for disaster.

Guy will demonstrate how you can mitigate this risk without losing productivity. We will also share data about risk, show how to find and fix known vulnerabilities in these dependencies, discuss how to prioritize the ones worthy of manual inspection, and suggest what to monitor in production.

Guy Podjarny (@guypod) is a cofounder at Snyk.io focusing on the security risk in your dependencies. Guy was previously CTO at Akamai and founder of Blaze.io, and worked on the first web app firewall, security static analysis tool. Guy is a frequent conference speaker, the author of "Responsive & Fast”, “High Performance Images” and the upcoming “Securing Third Party Code” (via O’Reilly), and the creator of Mobitest. 

Keith Horwood - Decoupling your API, how to do it and why it's important

Keith is joining us again from SF to talk about the future of the web, different clients that you can expect to connect to your API, and how to separate product concerns into different services. 

https://github.com/keithwhor https://twitter.com/keithwhor

Lightning Talks Spots Available! Reach out with topics to presentt!

***Note on security***: As always, please ensure your full name is listed on your Meetup profile, if you RSVP yes to join. Building security will need it to grant you access to the event.

We'll be trying out a new location, at Ebay's office just off 18th Street, this month. Thanks to Ebay for hosting! It's going to be a great event!

See you there!

- Matt
results.how_to_find_us: Stop by security on the way in, head up to the third floor and head to the main conference room.
results.name: Addressing the security risk in npm dependencies & Decoupling your API!

results.description:
This free session, recently presented at the Machine Learning Conference in New York City, will introduce the basics of working with textual data using various Python libraries and give several examples of real world applications. It will start by introducing the basic bag of word representation and move onto other models with an emphasis on word2vec. By the end of this talk, participants will be able to use Python to explore and build their own models on text data.

Your presenter is Michael Galvin, Sr. Data Scientist at Metis.

6:30 - 7:00 Register, Mingle, Eat & Drink 
7:00 - 7:45 Mike presents + Q&A
7:45 -  8:15 Networking

Michael Galvin 
Metis Sr. Data Scientist 

Michael comes to Metis from General Electric where he worked to establish the company’s data science strategy and capabilities for field services and to build solutions supporting global operations, risk, engineering, sales, and marketing. He also taught data science and machine learning for General Assembly. Prior to GE, Michael spent several years as a data scientist working on problems in credit modeling at Kabbage and corporate travel and procurement at TRX. Michael holds a Bachelor's degree in Mathematics and a Master's degree in Computational Science and Engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology where he also spent 3 years working on machine learning research problems related to computational biology and bioinformatics. Additionally, Michael spent 12 years in the United States Marine Corps where he held various leadership roles within aviation, logistics, and training units. In his spare time, he enjoys running, traveling, and reading.
results.name: Intro to Word2vec and Working With Text Data

results.description:
Dear New York Area Life Science Professionals,

We are honored to have Manu Jain, M.D. speak to us about her work.  Dr. Jain is a research pathologist at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. 

She is developing optical imaging techniques for non-invasive diagnosis of melanocytic and non-melanocytic carcinomas.   Her goal is to bring these techniques to the bedside and provide in vivo diagnosis to minimize the need for biopsies. 

She is working with a team of engineers and computational analysts to develop reliable parameters for computer-aided diagnosis to create mathematical models for quantitative analysis of confocal images of skin for in vivo diagnosis. 

Details:

Date - Wednesday, May 18th

Time - 6:30-8:30 pm

Place - 745 Fifth Avenue between 57th and 58th.  The entrance is on the 10th floor

Light refreshments will be served.

Please RSVP so we have an idea of the size of the crowd.

results.description:
Please join us at the next NYC Hyperledger Meetup.    We have a great agenda for the evening with two very interesting speakers from IBM and Digital Asset Holdings, and, if there is time, a short demo of some interesting Blockchain research.


Agenda

---------------------------------------------------------------


Introductions

---------------------------------------------------------------

Talk: Blockchain: Challenges and Emerging Applications

Dr. Krishna Ratakonda
IBM Fellow, Research Division. CTO, Blockchain Solutions

Focus areas are blockchain solutions, computational creativity, unstructured data analysis and cognitive models to predict organizational or individual decision dynamics.

Deep expertise in complex stochastic analysis to derive insights from large, heterogeneous and noisy data sets. Two time winner of IBM’s top technical award for breakthrough technical innovation in applying predictive analytics and stochastic planning algorithms to client problems.

Ph D in Electrical Engineering, University of Illinois at
Urbana-Champaign. Specialization in signal processing and statistical optimization. Outstanding thesis award. 40+ patents, 60+ publications, multiple best paper awards in the areas of signal processing and operations research.

---------------------------------------------------------------

Talk: Hyperledger, Digital Assets perspective.

Dan O’Prey
Chief Marketing Officer, Digital Asset Holdings

Dan is the Chief Marketing Officer at Digital Asset Holdings, a
developer of distributed ledger technology for the financial services industry.

Prior to his current role, Dan was the co-founder and CEO of
San-Francisco-based Hyperledger, a technology company that Digital Asset acquired in June. Hyperledger developed an innovative distributed ledger to allow financial institutions to clear and settle transactions in real-time by creating multiple private blockchains across a known group of participants.

Before Hyperledger, Dan lived in Beijing where he founded and served as the CEO of MadeiraCloud (Visual Ops), a visual cloud management and automation tool for Amazon Web Services.

Dan holds a bachelor’s degree in Business Management and Information Management from the University of Sheffield in the United Kingdom.

---------------------------------------------------------------


Demo: Solidity to go
Proof-of-concept translation of Solidity to go for Hyperledger chaincode.

Dr. Daniel Ford
Keoja LLC

Daniel is the Founder of Keoja LLC, a Blockchain research company.

Prior to Keoja, Daniel was Executive Director of Dell Research in Santa Clara, CA, and Dell's Chief Scientist for Mobility and The Internet of Things.  Before that he co-found Paupt Labs LLC, and held various research and management positions at the IBM Almaden Research Center in San Jose, CA.

Daniel has 28+ issued patents and dozens of publications.  He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Waterloo.
results.how_to_find_us: https://goo.gl/maps/LDb7dVqVR8w
results.name: NYC Hyperledger Meetup.

Sadly, how well you do at your job doesn't always correlate with how successful you are in your professional career. 

Despite your hardwork, others have gotten coveted roles and promotions you wanted! How frustrating and demotivating. 

Well, have no fear - NYC Game Changers will tackle this crucial issue in today's meetup! 

NYC Game Changers presents Rosie Dorce, Digital Marketing Leader and Brand Expert!

Rosie will present and teach us the principles laid out in Harvey Coleman's book, Empowering Yourself, The Organizational Game Revealed and his 3 key elements of PIE, Performance, Image and Exposure. 

Rosie will share her background and expertise on how she navigates her career through PIE. 

Follow Rosie on Twitter @rosiedorce!

We look forward to seeing you there!

- NYC Game Changers

results.description:
Join us the 3rd Wednesday of each month for networking and coding! 


Socializing starts at 6:30PM — Make new friends, find a study group or study partner, or just practice your people skills. :-) 

Xcoding — That's what it's all about, right? During a typical MeetUp people socialize, work on Stanford assignments, ask other members questions, ask for help with a bug, offer help to others, etc. There is no set agenda and no formal presentation. If you prefer to sit in a corner and code away, you can do that. If you want to walk around offering people a helping hand, you can do that too.

Just Getting Started? Follow these steps . . .

• Stanford University on iTunes U — Developing iOS 9 Apps with Swift 

• Download Xcode from the Mac App Store

• Sign up for a free Developer Account

results.description:
DESCRIPTION: This monthly meetup covers algorithms. We'll split attendees into two main groups:

Whiteboarding skills : You'll solve algorithms in small groups, breaking off into your preferred programming language and working together to find a solution. Problems are provided and vary in difficulty, check out the Github for examples of past problems: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

For Beginners : You'll pair with other members and practice answering easier algo questions. This group will be led by a more experienced developer who will help you out when you get stuck.

Schedule: 
6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code and Organizers 
7:05 Welcome from Betterment Engineering 
7:15 Meetup starts 
9:00 Event ends after solution presentation from volunteers

Resources: The WWCNYC Github contains questions (and solutions) from past events, as well as upcoming problems! Submit solutions, contribute interview questions and more: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Other resources: 

http://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~kelu/interviews/questions.html 
http://katemats.com/interview-questions/ 
http://meetupresources.herokuapp.com/index.html 
http://codingforinterviews.com/practice

Resources for beginners or anyone who needs to review:

http://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/algorithms-and-data-structures--cms-20437 
http://www.nczonline.net/blog/tag/algorithms/

For our beginners, we recommend creating accounts on either http://jsbin.com/ or http://codepen.io/, to give you an place to practice your algorithms problem-solving skills.

HOST: Betterment is the fastest-growing automated investing service, helping people to better manage, protect, and grow their wealth through smarter technology. The service offers a globally diversified portfolio of ETFs, designed to help provide you with the best possible expected returns for retirement planning, building wealth, and other savings goals. Betterment is a CNBC Disruptor 50 and Webby award winner and has been featured in the New York Times, Forbes, and the Wall Street Journal. Betterment helps people to achieve a smarter financial future with minimal effort and for a fraction of the cost of traditional financial services.

WWCode events are intended for all women (trans and cis), trans men, and genderqueer folks who are interested in attending. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly and committed to matters of social justice as an organization. Select events may be open to the general public, which will be clearly noted in event descriptions. Our Code of Conduct is in effect at all of our events. If you have any questions, please message the Directors of this chapter.
results.name: Algorithms @ Betterment

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING


This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

results.description:
DON'T HIRE A SALES TEAM, JOIN ONE! 

Welcome to TEAM Referral Network, where we are passionate about networking and connecting you with the right professionals to grow your business. TEAM Referral Network includes weekly meetings with your chapter, training programs, business development, and most importantly, quality business relationships.

HOW IT WORKS:

Membership is exclusive. Only one business for each category is allowed to join a TEAM Referral chapter. Weekly meetings give TEAM members the opportunity to market their business and get to know their fellow professionals and the business they represent. 

Members work together for a common goal: to increase their sales income and bottom line. 

WHY IT WORKS:

Everyone appreciates referrals! When people are looking for a product or service, a personal referral beats the Yellow Pages every time. Your business gains the competitive edge when a TEAM member refers someone to you and speaks well of your integrity, quality products and excellent service. If you do the same for your fellow TEAM members, everybody WINS!

There is so much more to TEAM Referral Network that happens outside of our chapter meetings. Members are encouraged to meet one-on-one with other members to get to know each other on a deeper level. The entire TEAM Referral Network has access to all members with the exclusive TEAM-sponsored member’s website. These “mini” websites give added value to your brand’s online presence and search engine rankings (SEO), as well as make it even easier for prospects to find your company online. TEAM Referral Network also provides regular business development trainings. TEAM Referral Network helps you exponentially expand your sphere of influence and grow your business referrals.

Come learn how to start or join a chapter!
results.how_to_find_us: One Penn Plaza 34th Street Between 7th and 8th Ste. 2035

results.description:
Think Small: Driving Change in the Food & Beverage IndustryWe have invited some of the most well-known and fascinating brands in the food and beverage industry to take part in a panel discussion. The difference is, the panelists are from two ends of the spectrum; the large and established power-brands with the eager and entrepreneurial start-ups. This sector is changing at a fast pace, but where is the dynamism coming from? 

‘Thinking Small’ is the natural behavior for start-ups, but the larger companies are starting to embrace this strategy. With more and more brands converging on the same ‘small’ path, we’ll hear how brands are defining their own route to success and what they are learning along the way. 

The event will be moderated by Alex Waters of The Value Engineers, who will begin the event by inviting introductions from each panelist, before commencing the discussion based around 5-6 Provocations. The panel discussion will last approximately 30-40 minutes, with 15-20 minutes at the end for an audience Q&A. 

A mixer will follow the discussion, where you will be offered complimentary food and beverages, as well as a few samples from our panelist brands – we hope to see you there!

Our panelists include:

Alastair Kenvyn – Global Director, Exploration at Anheuser-Busch InBev ZX Ventures

Dawn Techow –  Co-Founder of Relish Food Project

Gerry Schweitzer – President, Rocketlust Communications

Grady Laird – Cook, Editor, Writer, Entrepreneur, and Co-Founder of Grady's Cold Brew

Jake Kirsch – VP National Craft at Anheuser-BuschJenny Danzi – Senior Brand Manager, Pepsi TM at PepsiCo

Lirra Schiebler Hill – Director of Brand Strategy at Farmigo

Lori Zoppel -  President, LZ Marketing Consulting, LLC; Unilever Global Marketing Executive (retired)

If you are unable to join on the night but are still interested in participating, we’ll be broadcasting the event live through Periscope. The easiest way to join from wherever you are is:

1) Download the Periscope App

2) Follow @ValueEngineers 

3) Turn on notifications and Periscope will instantly notify you when this event is about to start. You‘ll be able to comment and ask questions in real time. 

Alternatively, you can use the link posted live to Twitter@ValueEngineers to watch the event without commenting; just use #thinksmall to send us any questions.
results.name: Think Small: Driving Change in the Food & Beverage Industry Panel Discussion

results.description:
As usual we're continuing our pursuit of pushing the edges of what we can do with web layouts using CSS. 

For those of you who are looking for a challenge, we'll have 6 layout tasks pre-made and ready for you to tackle. The aim for each of these is to throw yourself fully into using the new CSS grid spec, flexbox, and any other layout based properties you'd like to sink your teeth into.

Not into the challenge? Just want to know what the heck all of these new features are all about? We'll be placing individuals into groups to leaf through these specs section by section. You'll walk out with a better understanding of how these layout models work under the hood.

Have you own thing and just want a cool group of people like-minded to run it by? Bring yourself along and share with the crew. We're all in this layout game together. 

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Hack on Experimental Layouts in CSS

results.description:
Find tickets here: http://bit.ly/1VeYqc4


So you’ve lit up an LED and the question is “ok now what?” Well, the beauty of the microcontroller is the myriad of sensors and real-time feedback you can create to make awesome projects. Whether you are building a burglar alarm, a robot, microbrew system, auto-watering garden, or turning your lights on and off working with sensors and input/output devices is key to taking the next step. 

We are going to have a plethora of sensors on hand to experiment with as we grab materials and build projects to learn how to pick a sensor, popular sources, howto implement it and how to think outside the box to build your next project. Don’t let your arduino collect dust. Let’s dust it off and build something awesome! 


Please feel encouraged to bring your own sensors and we will do our best to implement it and get those creative juices flowing. 

**Located at SIMakerSpace**Cross Promoting**Taught by the Director of the CSI Tech Incubator**
results.name: Arduino: Getting to Know Your Sensors

A Dim Sum Dinner Delight Description

Dim sum, translated to "touch your heart" from Cantonese, is a unique culinary experience originating in southern China. This experience comes to the "kommunity" through a twelve item dim sum tasting dinner, filled with delicious bites to expose you to the delightful & unique Cantonese cuisine.

About Oriental Garden

Located in the heart of Chinatown in New York City, Oriental Garden is "where your favorite chefs eat on their days off." The Hong Kong style restaurant is known for its phenomenally fresh seafood, with crabs, fish, lobster cooked fresh from its fish tanks.

Menu Description

Steamed Dishes: 

Pork Shumai (Pork Dumplings) | Cha Siu Bao (BBQ Pork Bun) | Ha Gao (Shrimp Dumplings)

Exotic Dishes:

Beef & Shrimp Rice Noodle Rolls | Sauteed Chicken Feet | Steamed Spare Ribs

Fried Dishes:

Fried Shrimp Roll | Fried Crab Claw | Lotus Leaf Sticky Rice

Sweet Dishes (Dessert):

Egg Tarts | Baked Custard Bun | Almond Tofu Pudding

Komeeda Event Details

Address: 14 Elizabeth St, New York, NY

Price: $30. Includes meal, beverages, tax and tip. Just show up and eat!

Seats Available:24

Purchase your seat here!

Join us for this free open doors session to get an overview of our part-time product management course curriculum, meet the lead instructor and have the chance to ask any additional questions that you might have about what it takes to become a product manager in New York City:


<a>http://www.productschool.com/</a>;

All our classes are compatible with a regular work schedule and our campus is conveniently located in Manhattan. This is not your traditional lecture class. Expect a healthy mix of group work, one-­on-­ones with mentors, and a hands­-on experience building your own digital product from end to end.

The instructors are professionals with real-world experience working at renowned tech Companies like Google and LinkedIn, and other technology startups.

We have assembled a list of local hiring partners who are eagerly looking for our top Product School students.

Timeline: 

6:30 - 6:45 pm - Meet & Greet  

6:45 - 7:15 pm - Info Session 

7:15 - 7:30 pm - Q & A 


*wine & refreshments will be provided

Takeaways:

• Meet the Product School Team and potential classmates

• Get an overview of the curriculum and course objectives

• Meet the Lead Instructor and hear about his background 

• Have the chance to ask Product School Alumni questions about their experience

Meet our instructor: 

JP Park is the VP Product at HealthKick. Previously, he’s managed digital products at TheLadders for their recruiter ecosystem, at FanDuel for their core game mechanics and at Nielsen for their digital advertising measurement portfolio.. He received his B.S. in Operations Research from Columbia University.

Where:

Grind isn’t an office, it’s the antidote to offices. A members-only shared workspace and coworking community dedicated to taking all of the frustrations of working the old way and pulverizing them to a dust so fine it actually oils the wheels of the machine.

** Click link to attend: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/product-management-course-new-york-info-session-tickets-24235819990**
results.name: Product Management Course - New York Info Session

results.description:
A Dim Sum Dinner Delight Description


Dim sum, translated to "touch your heart" from Cantonese, is a unique culinary experience originating in southern China. This experience comes to the "kommunity" through a twelve item dim sum tasting dinner, filled with delicious bites to expose you to the delightful & unique Cantonese cuisine.

About Oriental Garden

Located in the heart of Chinatown in New York City, Oriental Garden is "where your favorite chefs eat on their days off." The Hong Kong style restaurant is known for its phenomenally fresh seafood, with crabs, fish, lobster cooked fresh from its fish tanks.

Menu Description

Steamed Dishes: 

Pork Shumai (Pork Dumplings) | Cha Siu Bao (BBQ Pork Bun) | Ha Gao (Shrimp Dumplings)

Exotic Dishes:

Beef & Shrimp Rice Noodle Rolls | Sauteed Chicken Feet | Steamed Spare Ribs

Fried Dishes:

Fried Shrimp Roll | Fried Crab Claw | Lotus Leaf Sticky Rice

Sweet Dishes (Dessert):

Egg Tarts | Baked Custard Bun | Almond Tofu Pudding

Event Details

Address: 14 Elizabeth St, New York, NY

Price: $30. Includes meal, beverages, tax and tip. Just show up and eat!

Seats Available:24

Purchase your seat here!
results.name: A Dim Sum Dinner Delight - Twelve Course Cantonese Adventure
